monsters.name: Bandit
monsters.description: Bandits are ruthless outlaws who live by raiding settlements and robbing travelers. They typically wear leather armor and carry whatever weapons they can steal. Most bandits are desperate individuals driven to crime by poverty or greed.
monsters.actions: Scimitar: +3 to hit, 1d6+1 slashing. Light Crossbow: +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., 1d8+1 piercing.

monsters.name: Giant Spider
monsters.senses: Blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10
monsters.description: Giant spiders are horrifying predators the size of horses. They have bulbous bodies covered in coarse black hair, eight legs that span 10 feet, and multiple eyes that gleam with malevolent intelligence. They lurk in dark places, spinning sticky webs to trap their prey.
monsters.traits: Spider Climb: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without ability checks. Web Sense: While in contact with a web, knows exact location of any creature in contact with the same web. Web Walker: Ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.
monsters.actions: Bite: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing plus 2d8 poison damage. Target must make DC 11 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 hour. If save fails by 5 or more, target is unconscious while poisoned. Web (Recharge 5-6): +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., target is restrained by webbing. DC 12 Strength check to burst free. AC 10, 5 HP, vulnerable to fire.

monsters.name: Animated Armor
monsters.condition_immunities: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
monsters.senses: Blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6
monsters.description: This empty suit of full plate armor clanks and moves with a warrior's purpose, despite having no body inside. Animated by magic, it serves its creator with unwavering loyalty. When motionless, it appears to be nothing more than a normal suit of armor on display.
monsters.traits: Antimagic Susceptibility: Incapacitated while in area of antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, must succeed on Constitution save against caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute. False Appearance: While motionless, indistinguishable from normal armor.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two melee attacks. Slam: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 bludgeoning.

monsters.name: Goblin Scout
monsters.description: Goblin scouts are nimble spies who range far from their tribes to gather intelligence on potential threats and targets. They wear dark leather armor and carry curved daggers and shortbows. Their keen eyes and quick reflexes make them excellent at avoiding detection.
monsters.traits: Nimble Escape: Can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each turn.
monsters.actions: Scimitar: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Shortbow: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., 1d6+2 piercing. Warning Cry: All goblins within 60 feet gain advantage on initiative rolls for the next minute.

monsters.name: Brown Bear
monsters.description: Brown bears are massive omnivores that can weigh over 800 pounds. They have thick brown fur, powerful claws, and a keen sense of smell. While normally peaceful unless threatened, a mother bear protecting her cubs or a bear defending its territory becomes a terrifying opponent.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claw. Bite: +5 to hit, 1d8+4 piercing. Claw: +5 to hit, 2d6+4 slashing.

monsters.name: Stirge
monsters.description: A stirge is a horrifying cross between a large bat and a mosquito, with leathery wings, a skeletal frame, and a long proboscis used to drain blood from its victims. They hunt in swarms, attracted by the scent of warm blood, and attach themselves to creatures to feed.
monsters.traits: Blood Drain: While attached to a creature, the stirge doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the stirge's turns, the target loses 1d4+1 hit points due to blood loss. The stirge can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It falls off if the target or another creature uses an action to detach it.
monsters.actions: Blood Drain: +5 to hit, 1d4+3 piercing. If the target is a creature, the stirge attaches to it.

monsters.name: Hobgoblin Warrior
monsters.description: Hobgoblins are militaristic cousins of goblins, standing nearly as tall as humans but with orange or red-orange skin and dark hair. They organize into disciplined armies with strict hierarchies, favoring heavy armor and martial weapons. Their tactical acumen makes them dangerous foes.
monsters.traits: Martial Advantage: Once per turn, deals an extra 1d6 damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally that isn't incapacitated.
monsters.actions: Longsword: +3 to hit, 1d8+1 slashing. Javelin: +3 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d6+1 piercing.

monsters.name: Dire Wolf
monsters.description: Dire wolves are ancient predators that hunt in packs across wilderness areas. Larger and more ferocious than their common cousins, they stand nearly four feet at the shoulder with powerful jaws and penetrating yellow eyes. They are highly intelligent pack hunters.
monsters.traits: Keen Hearing and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell. Pack Tactics: Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one ally is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
monsters.actions: Bite: +5 to hit, 2d6+3 piercing. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Rust Monster
monsters.description: A rust monster resembles a giant armadillo with a long tail ending in a paddle-like appendage. Its hide is rust-colored and covered in thick, scaly plates. Two long antennae extend from its head, constantly twitching as they sense nearby metal. These creatures feed on metal, reducing even magical items to rust.
monsters.traits: Iron Scent: Can pinpoint the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet. Rust Metal: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal is destroyed after hitting the rust monster.
monsters.actions: Bite: +3 to hit, 1d8+1 piercing. Antennae: The rust monster corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried, its bearer can make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw to avoid the rust monster's touch.

monsters.name: Ghoul
monsters.description: Ghouls are ravenous undead that hunger for the flesh of the living. Once humanoid, they have been transformed by dark magic or disease into pale, gaunt creatures with long claws and sharp teeth. Their touch carries a paralyzing curse that leaves victims helpless.
monsters.traits: Paralyzing Touch: When the ghoul hits a living creature other than an elf with its claws, the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
monsters.actions: Bite: +2 to hit, 2d6+2 piercing. Claws: +4 to hit, 2d4+2 slashing. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute.

monsters.name: Owlbear Cub
monsters.description: An owlbear cub is a younger version of the fearsome owlbear, combining the keen senses of an owl with the strength of a bear. Though smaller than its parent, it still poses a significant threat with razor-sharp claws and a powerful beak. Owlbear cubs are fiercely territorial and often more aggressive than adults.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws. Beak: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing. Claws: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 slashing.

monsters.name: Shadow
monsters.damage_resistances: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained
monsters.description: Shadows are undead creatures born from the essence of darkness itself. They appear as two-dimensional silhouettes that flicker and dance across walls and floors. These malevolent spirits drain the strength from living creatures, potentially creating more shadows from their victims.
monsters.traits: Amorphous: Can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. Shadow Stealth: While in dim light or darkness, can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Sunlight Weakness: While in sunlight, has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.
monsters.actions: Strength Drain: +4 to hit, 2d6+2 necrotic damage. The target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

monsters.name: Dryad
monsters.description: Dryads are graceful fey creatures bound to specific trees in ancient forests. They appear as beautiful humanoid women with bark-like skin and hair resembling leaves or moss. Peaceful by nature, they fiercely protect their forest homes from those who would harm them.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Speak with Beasts and Plants: Can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language. Tree Stride: Once on her turn, can use 10 feet of movement to step magically into one living tree within reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree.
monsters.actions: Club: +2 to hit, 1d4 bludgeoning. Fey Charm: Target humanoid within 30 feet must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On failure, target is charmed for 1 day. While charmed, target idolizes the dryad and tries to help her. Target can repeat save every 24 hours.

monsters.name: Copper Wyrmling
monsters.senses: Blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12
monsters.description: Copper wyrmlings are the youngest of the metallic dragons, known for their mischievous nature and love of jokes and riddles. Their scales shimmer with a warm copper hue that becomes more lustrous with age. Even as hatchlings, they display the wit and cunning that will define them as adults.
monsters.traits: Keen Senses: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d10+2 piercing plus 1d4 acid damage. Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales acid in a 15-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

monsters.name: Brass Wyrmling
monsters.senses: Blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12
monsters.description: Brass wyrmlings are the most talkative of young dragons, with scales that gleam like polished brass in desert sunlight. They love conversation and will often engage travelers in lengthy discussions about trivial matters. Their breath weapon can put enemies to sleep rather than harm them.
monsters.traits: Keen Senses: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d10+2 piercing. Sleep Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales sleep gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 1 minute. This effect ends for a creature if it takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

monsters.name: Faerie Dragon
monsters.description: Faerie dragons are tiny, cat-sized dragons with brilliant, iridescent scales that shift through all colors of the rainbow. Despite their diminutive size, they are intelligent and magical creatures with a mischievous streak. They delight in playing pranks on larger creatures and have a particular fondness for shiny objects.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Superior Invisibility: As a bonus action, can magically turn invisible until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment it wears or carries is invisible with it.
monsters.actions: Bite: +6 to hit, 1 piercing. Euphoria Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales a cloud of euphoric gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed for 1 minute. While charmed, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0.

monsters.name: Pseudodragon
monsters.senses: Blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 13
monsters.languages: Understands Common and Draconic but can't speak
monsters.description: Pseudodragons are the smallest of the dragon family, about the size of a house cat with reddish-brown scales and a stinger-tipped tail. They are highly intelligent and make excellent familiars for spellcasters. Their telepathic abilities and loyalty make them valued companions.
monsters.traits: Keen Senses: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Limited Telepathy: Can magically communicate simple emotions and concepts telepathically with any creature within 100 feet that can understand a language.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing. Sting: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing plus target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls unconscious for the same duration.

monsters.name: Wyvern Hatchling
monsters.description: Wyvern hatchlings are young versions of the fearsome two-legged dragons. Unlike true dragons, they lack forelimbs and instead have wings attached to their arms. Even as juveniles, they possess the signature venomous stinger tail that makes adult wyverns so dangerous. Their scales are typically dark green or brown.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing. Stinger: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing plus target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

monsters.name: Crystal Drake
monsters.description: Crystal drakes are beautiful but dangerous creatures whose scales appear to be made of living gemstone. They are drawn to areas rich in minerals and precious stones, often making their lairs in crystal caves or mine shafts. Their breath weapon creates sharp crystal formations that can trap enemies.
monsters.traits: Crystal Body: When the drake takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, crystal shards fly off. Each creature within 5 feet must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claw. Bite: +5 to hit, 2d6+3 piercing. Claw: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 slashing. Crystal Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales crystal shards in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The area becomes difficult terrain until cleared.

monsters.name: Shadow Drake
monsters.senses: Blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 14
monsters.description: Shadow drakes are sinister creatures that dwell in places where darkness reigns. Their scales are deep black and seem to absorb light, making them difficult to see in dim conditions. They can manipulate shadows to confuse enemies and their breath weapon drains the life force from their victims.
monsters.traits: Shadow Camouflage: While in dim light or darkness, has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. Sunlight Sensitivity: While in bright light, has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claw. Bite: +5 to hit, 1d10+2 piercing plus 1d4 necrotic damage. Claw: +5 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Shadow Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales shadowy energy in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 4d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

monsters.name: Storm Drake
monsters.senses: Blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 14
monsters.description: Storm drakes are majestic creatures that soar through thunderclouds and ride the winds of powerful storms. Their blue-white scales crackle with electrical energy, and their presence is often accompanied by rolling thunder. They are drawn to high peaks and stormy weather, reveling in the power of nature's fury.
monsters.traits: Storm Sense: Can predict weather changes up to 24 hours in advance. While flying during a storm, has advantage on all attack rolls.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes three attacks: one bite and two claws. Bite: +6 to hit, 2d8+4 piercing plus 1d6 lightning damage. Claw: +6 to hit, 1d8+4 slashing. Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales lightning in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

monsters.name: Void Wyrmling
monsters.senses: Blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 13
monsters.description: Void wyrmlings are born from the spaces between realities, their scales appearing as patches of star-filled darkness. Even as younglings, they possess an unsettling intelligence and knowledge of cosmic secrets. Their breath weapon tears holes in reality itself, creating areas of dangerous void energy.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Void Sight: Can see normally in magical darkness.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d10+2 piercing plus 1d6 psychic damage. Void Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales void energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw, taking 4d6 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The area becomes a zone of warped reality for 1 minute, imposing disadvantage on concentration saves.

monsters.name: Emerald Wyrmling
monsters.senses: Blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 13
monsters.description: Emerald wyrmlings are among the most cunning of young dragons, with brilliant green scales that seem to shift and change like living emeralds. They possess powerful psychic abilities even at a young age and delight in mental manipulation and trickery. Their curiosity about humanoid psychology often leads them to observe settlements from afar.
monsters.traits: Telepathic Bond: Can form a telepathic link with one willing creature within 60 feet. The link lasts 1 hour and allows communication regardless of language barriers.
monsters.actions: Bite: +5 to hit, 1d10+3 piercing. Claw: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 slashing. Psychic Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales psychic energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw, taking 4d6 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save also have their movement speed reduced by half until the end of their next turn.

monsters.name: City Watch Captain
monsters.description: City watch captains are experienced law enforcement officers who patrol the streets and maintain order in urban areas. They wear polished chainmail with the city's insignia and carry well-maintained weapons. These veterans have seen every type of criminal activity and know the city's layout intimately.
monsters.traits: Authority: Citizens and lower-ranking guards defer to the captain's commands unless given reason not to. Rally the Watch: Can blow a horn to summon 1d4+1 guards who arrive in 2d4 rounds.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two longsword attacks or two crossbow attacks. Longsword: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 slashing. Heavy Crossbow: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., 1d10+1 piercing. Commanding Shout: All allies within 30 feet gain advantage on their next attack roll.

monsters.name: Sewer Rat Swarm
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Prone, Restrained, Stunned
monsters.description: The sewers beneath every major city teem with countless rats that have grown fat on refuse and waste. When threatened or extremely hungry, these vermin band together in writhing, chittering swarms that can overwhelm even armed opponents. They carry diseases from the filthy environments they inhabit.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Swarm: Can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.
monsters.actions: Bites: +2 to hit, 2d6 piercing, or 1d6 piercing if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer. If the target is a creature, it must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature contracts sewer plague and becomes poisoned until cured.

monsters.name: Street Performer
monsters.description: Street performers are common sights in city squares and marketplaces, entertaining crowds with music, juggling, acrobatics, or magic tricks. While most are harmless entertainers seeking coins, some use their performances as cover for pickpocketing, information gathering, or other illicit activities.
monsters.traits: Crowd Blending: While in a crowd of at least 6 people, has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. Distracting Performance: As an action, can force all creatures within 15 feet to make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on Perception checks until the start of the performer's next turn.
monsters.actions: Dagger: +3 to hit, 1d4+1 piercing. Thrown Objects: +3 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d4+1 bludgeoning. Entertain: Gains 1d4 copper pieces from nearby crowds per minute of performance.

monsters.name: Guild Spy
monsters.description: Guild spies are agents employed by merchant guilds, thieves' guilds, or other urban organizations to gather intelligence, conduct surveillance, and protect their employers' interests. They blend seamlessly into city life, appearing as ordinary citizens while pursuing their clandestine activities.
monsters.traits: Urban Camouflage: While in an urban environment, can take the Hide action even when only lightly obscured. Network of Contacts: Once per day, can spend 10 minutes to gather information about local events, people, or locations.
monsters.actions: Shortsword: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing. Dagger: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d4+2 piercing. Sneak Attack: Once per turn, deals an extra 1d6 damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if it has advantage on the attack roll.

monsters.name: Tavern Brawler
monsters.description: Tavern brawlers are rowdy patrons who frequent the drinking establishments of cities and towns. These burly individuals are quick to start fights over perceived slights, unpaid debts, or simple drunken disagreements. They fight with whatever weapons are at hand, often chairs, bottles, or their bare fists.
monsters.traits: Tavern Fighter: Proficient with improvised weapons and deals +2 damage with them. Liquid Courage: While intoxicated, has advantage on saving throws against being frightened and gains resistance to bludgeoning damage.
monsters.actions: Unarmed Strike: +5 to hit, 1d4+3 bludgeoning. Improvised Weapon: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 bludgeoning (chair, bottle, mug, etc.). Grapple: +5 to hit, target is grappled (escape DC 13). Tavern Throw: Can throw a grappled Medium or smaller creature up to 10 feet. Both the thrown creature and any creature it hits take 1d6 bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Corrupt Noble
monsters.description: Corrupt nobles are members of the aristocracy who have abandoned honor in favor of personal gain. They use their wealth, influence, and connections to manipulate the political landscape for their own benefit. Behind their refined facades lurk ruthless minds willing to eliminate obstacles to their ambitions.
monsters.traits: Political Immunity: Once per day, can avoid the consequences of one illegal action through bribes, threats, or influence. Wealth and Connections: Can spend gold to hire mercenaries, bribe officials, or gain access to restricted areas.
monsters.actions: Rapier: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 piercing. Dagger: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d4+2 piercing. Command Guards: Summons 1d4 guards who arrive in 1d4 rounds. Bribery: Target humanoid must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed for 1 hour, seeing the noble as a benefactor.

monsters.name: Clockwork Sentinel
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
monsters.description: Clockwork sentinels are mechanical guardians created by skilled artificers to patrol city districts and protect important buildings. Made of brass and steel with glowing crystal eyes, they follow simple programmed commands with unwavering dedication. Gears whir and steam hisses as they patrol their assigned routes.
monsters.traits: Immutable Form: Immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Patrol Route: Follows a predetermined path unless commanded otherwise or detecting intruders.
monsters.actions: Slam: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 bludgeoning. Stunning Strike: If the slam attack hits, the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of their next turn (recharge 5-6). Alert Whistle: Emits a loud whistle that can be heard up to 300 feet away, alerting guards or other sentinels.

monsters.name: Gargoyle Guardian
monsters.damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.description: Gargoyle guardians are animated stone statues that protect important buildings such as temples, noble estates, and government structures. During the day, they remain motionless, indistinguishable from decorative stonework. At night or when threatened, they spring to life with grinding stone movements.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue. Damage Transfer: While touching a building it guards, can transfer up to half the damage it takes to the building instead.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claw. Bite: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing. Claw: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Stone Throw: +2 to hit, range 60/240 ft., 1d12+2 bludgeoning.

monsters.name: Plague Zombie
monsters.languages: Understands languages it knew in life but can't speak
monsters.description: Plague zombies are the reanimated corpses of those who died from virulent diseases that swept through crowded urban areas. Their rotting flesh still carries traces of the sickness that killed them, making them walking sources of contagion. They shamble through abandoned city districts, spreading pestilence.
monsters.traits: Undead Fortitude: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead. Disease Carrier: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the zombie must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.
monsters.actions: Slam: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 bludgeoning plus 1d4 poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or contract sewer plague. Infectious Bite: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 piercing. The target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become infected with a disease that prevents regaining hit points until cured.

monsters.name: Master Thief
monsters.skills: Acrobatics +6, Deception +4, Perception +4, Sleight of Hand +8, Stealth +8
monsters.languages: Common, Thieves' Cant plus one other
monsters.description: Master thieves are elite criminals who have perfected the art of larceny in urban environments. They know every rooftop, alley, and secret passage in their territory. These skilled rogues can slip past guards, disable complex locks, and vanish into crowds with practiced ease.
monsters.traits: Cunning Action: Can take a Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each turn. Evasion: When subjected to an effect that allows a Dexterity saving throw for half damage, takes no damage on a success and half damage on a failure. Urban Movement: Climbing speed of 30 feet in urban environments.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two shortsword attacks or two dagger attacks. Shortsword: +6 to hit, 1d6+4 piercing. Dagger: +6 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d4+4 piercing. Sneak Attack: Once per turn, deals an extra 2d6 damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if it has advantage. Smoke Bomb: Creates a 15-foot radius cloud of smoke, heavily obscuring the area for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Forest Sprite
monsters.description: Forest sprites are tiny fey creatures no larger than a person's hand, with delicate translucent wings like those of dragonflies. They have gossamer hair that changes color with the seasons and wear clothing made from flower petals and leaves. These mischievous beings delight in playing harmless pranks on forest travelers.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Flyby: Doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.
monsters.actions: Longsword: +2 to hit, 1 slashing. Shortbow: +6 to hit, range 40/160 ft., 1 piercing plus poison (DC 10 Constitution save or poisoned for 1 minute). Invisibility: Magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends.

monsters.name: Dire Squirrel
monsters.description: Dire squirrels are unusually large and aggressive woodland rodents, standing about two feet tall with bushy tails and sharp claws. Unlike their smaller cousins, these creatures are territorial and will aggressively defend their tree homes and food caches from intruders. Their cheeks can store surprisingly large objects.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Tree Dweller: Has a climbing speed equal to its walking speed and can move through tree branches without penalty.
monsters.actions: Bite: +5 to hit, 1d4+3 piercing. Claw: +5 to hit, 1d4+3 slashing. Acorn Barrage: Throws 1d4 acorns at targets within 30 feet. Each acorn requires a separate attack roll (+5 to hit) and deals 1d4+3 bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Woodland Scout
monsters.skills: Animal Handling +4, Nature +3, Perception +4, Stealth +5, Survival +6
monsters.description: Woodland scouts are rangers and hunters who have dedicated their lives to protecting the forest and its inhabitants. They wear earth-toned leather armor decorated with natural materials and move through the trees with practiced silence. Many serve as guides for travelers or guards for druidic groves.
monsters.traits: Forest Camouflage: While in forested terrain, has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. Favored Enemy: Deals +2 damage against monstrosities and undead.
monsters.actions: Scimitar: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 slashing. Longbow: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., 1d8+3 piercing. Hunter's Mark: As a bonus action, marks a creature within 90 feet for 1 hour. Deals +1d6 damage to marked target and has advantage on tracking it.

monsters.name: Awakened Shrub
monsters.languages: One language known by its creator
monsters.description: Awakened shrubs are ordinary bushes that have been granted consciousness and mobility through druidic magic. They appear as normal vegetation until they move, revealing their animated nature through rustling leaves and creaking branches. Most are curious about the world around them and eager to help forest guardians.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from a normal shrub. Plant Camouflage: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in areas with ample vegetation.
monsters.actions: Rake: +1 to hit, 1d4-1 slashing. Entangle: Nearby roots and vines sprout from the ground in a 10-foot square within 30 feet. Each creature in the area must make a DC 10 Strength saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Owlbear Cub
monsters.description: Owlbear cubs are the offspring of the fearsome owlbear, combining the features of a great horned owl and a bear. Though smaller than their parents, they still stand about four feet tall and possess the same predatory instincts. Their downy feathers are mottled brown and their yellow eyes gleam with feral intelligence.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one beak and one claw. Beak: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing. Claw: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 slashing.

monsters.name: Treant Sapling
monsters.description: Treant saplings are young tree shepherds who have not yet reached their full size and power. Standing about eight feet tall, they appear as humanoid trees with bark-like skin and branches for arms. Their faces are kind but stern, reflecting their role as protectors of the forest.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from a normal tree. Speak with Plants: Can communicate with plants as if they shared a language.
monsters.actions: Slam: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 bludgeoning. Rock: +4 to hit, range 60/180 ft., 1d10+2 bludgeoning. Animate Trees: Causes 1d2 trees within 60 feet to become animated for 1 day (1/day). The trees have the statistics of awakened trees but only 30 hit points.

monsters.name: Forest Gnome Druid
monsters.description: Forest gnome druids are small humanoids who have formed deep connections with woodland creatures and plants. They stand about three feet tall with earth-toned skin and hair that often has leaves or flowers woven into it. These wise guardians use their magic to maintain the balance of nature.
monsters.traits: Gnome Cunning: Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic. Speak with Small Beasts: Can communicate simple concepts with Small or smaller beasts.
monsters.actions: Scimitar: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Sling: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d4+2 bludgeoning. Spellcasting: 3rd-level spellcaster, spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks. Spells: Cantrips (2): druidcraft, guidance. 1st level (4): cure wounds, entangle, speak with animals. 2nd level (2): barkskin, hold person.

monsters.name: Giant Badger
monsters.description: Giant badgers are aggressive burrowing mammals that grow to the size of large dogs. They have powerful claws for digging, distinctive black and white striped fur, and a fierce temperament when threatened. These creatures excavate extensive tunnel systems beneath the forest floor.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Burrow: Can tunnel through soil and loose earth, leaving a 5-foot diameter tunnel.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claw. Bite: +3 to hit, 1d6+1 piercing. Claw: +3 to hit, 1d6+1 slashing.

monsters.name: Dryad Guardian
monsters.description: Dryad guardians are powerful fey who have sworn to protect sacred groves and ancient forests. More martially inclined than their peaceful sisters, they possess both natural magic and combat skills. Their skin resembles bark, their hair flows like leaves in the wind, and their eyes glow with green fire when angered.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Tree Stride: Once per turn, can use 10 feet of movement to step into one living tree within reach and emerge from another tree within 60 feet. Speak with Beasts and Plants: Can communicate with beasts and plants.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two scimitar attacks or casts two spells. Scimitar: +6 to hit, 1d6+4 slashing plus 1d6 poison damage. Thorn Whip: +5 spell attack, range 30 ft., 1d6 piercing damage and pulls target 10 feet closer. Entangle (3/Day): DC 15 Strength save in 20-foot square or restrained by plants for 1 minute. Barkskin (1/Day): AC becomes 16 for 1 hour.

monsters.name: Corrupted Treant
monsters.description: Corrupted treants are tree shepherds who have been twisted by dark magic or exposure to evil influences. Their bark is blackened and diseased, their branches are gnarled and threatening, and their once-kind eyes now burn with malevolent intelligence. They spread blight wherever they walk.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from a dead or diseased tree. Blight Aura: Plants within 30 feet wither and die. Living creatures starting their turn in this area take 1d4 necrotic damage.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two slam attacks. Slam: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., 2d8+4 bludgeoning plus 1d6 necrotic damage. Rock: +6 to hit, range 60/180 ft., 2d10+4 bludgeoning. Animate Blighted Trees: Causes 1d3 dead trees within 60 feet to become hostile animated trees for 1 hour (1/day).

monsters.name: Dire Wolverine
monsters.description: Dire wolverines are massive, aggressive predators with incredibly powerful jaws and razor-sharp claws. Standing three feet at the shoulder, they have thick, dark fur and a fearless disposition that makes them willing to attack creatures much larger than themselves. Their musky scent marks their territory for miles.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Relentless: When reduced to 0 hit points but not killed, drops to 1 hit point instead (recharges on a long rest).
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claw. Bite: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing. If the target is prone, the bite deals an additional 1d4 piercing damage. Claw: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 slashing. Savage Charge: If the wolverine moves at least 20 feet toward a target and hits with a claw attack, the target must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Sylvan Archer
monsters.description: Sylvan archers are elite woodland warriors who have trained extensively in the art of archery and forest survival. They wear green and brown clothing that helps them blend with their surroundings and carry bows made from the finest yew wood. These skilled marksmen can fire arrows with supernatural accuracy.
monsters.traits: Forest Movement: Difficult terrain composed of nonmagical plants doesn't cost extra movement. Archery Fighting Style: Gains +2 bonus to ranged weapon attack rolls.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two longbow attacks or one longbow attack and moves up to half speed. Longsword: +3 to hit, 1d8+1 slashing. Longbow: +8 to hit, range 150/600 ft., 1d8+6 piercing. Volley (Recharge 5-6): Fires arrows at three different targets within range, making separate attack rolls for each.

monsters.name: Shambling Mound Spawn
monsters.description: Shambling mound spawn are smaller versions of the terrible shambling mounds, composed of rotting vegetation, moss, and vines animated by dark magic. They lurk in the deepest parts of swampy forests, ambushing travelers from beneath the murky water or among thick undergrowth.
monsters.traits: Lightning Absorption: When subjected to lightning damage, takes no damage and regains hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt. Swamp Camouflage: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in swampy terrain.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two slam attacks. Slam: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 bludgeoning plus 1d4 poison damage. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled and restrained. Engulf: Grappled creature takes 2d8+3 bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the spawn's turns.

monsters.name: Ancient Elk
monsters.description: Ancient elks are majestic creatures that have lived for centuries in the deep forests. Their antlers span eight feet across and seem to shimmer with an inner light. These wise beasts are revered by druids and forest folk as symbols of the woodland's enduring strength and natural majesty.
monsters.traits: Keen Hearing and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell. Charge: If the elk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits with a ram attack, the target takes an extra 2d6 damage and must make a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
monsters.actions: Ram: +6 to hit, 1d8+4 bludgeoning. Hooves: +6 to hit, 2d4+4 bludgeoning (only against prone targets). Inspiring Presence: All beasts within 30 feet gain advantage on their next attack roll or saving throw (1/day).

monsters.name: Forest Witch
monsters.description: Forest witches are mysterious spellcasters who have made pacts with dark fey or forest spirits. They live in secluded cottages deep in the woods, brewing potions and weaving curses. Their magic draws from both arcane studies and primal forest powers, making them unpredictable opponents.
monsters.traits: Spellcasting: 5th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks. Hex Magic: Can place curses that impose disadvantage on ability checks. Forest Network: Can communicate with plants and woodland creatures to gather information.
monsters.actions: Quarterstaff: +1 to hit, 1d6-1 bludgeoning (1d8-1 if used two-handed). Witch Bolt: +5 spell attack, range 30 ft., 1d12 lightning damage and creates a link for ongoing damage. Spells: Cantrips (3): eldritch blast, minor illusion, poison spray. 1st level (4): charm person, hex, sleep. 2nd level (3): hold person, misty step, suggestion. 3rd level (2): counterspell, fireball.

monsters.name: Cave Fisher
monsters.description: Cave fishers are large, lobster-like predators that lurk on cave ceilings and rocky overhangs. They have powerful claws and can extend long, sticky filaments to snare prey from great distances. Their chitinous shells are mottled gray and brown, helping them blend with stone surfaces.
monsters.traits: Adhesive Filament: Can shoot a sticky filament up to 60 feet. If it hits a Large or smaller creature, the target is grappled. The filament can be severed (AC 15, 5 hp) or the fisher can retract it as a bonus action. Spider Climb: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without ability checks.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two claw attacks. Claw: +7 to hit, 2d6+5 slashing. Filament: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., target is grappled and pulled up to 60 feet toward the fisher. Reel In: Pulls a grappled creature up to 30 feet closer and makes a claw attack against it with advantage.

monsters.name: Deep Gnome Scout
monsters.description: Deep gnomes, also known as svirfneblin, are hardy subterranean folk who have adapted to life in the deepest caves and tunnels. They have gray, rocky skin that helps them blend with stone, and their eyes have adapted to see clearly in complete darkness. These scouts patrol their territory with quiet efficiency.
monsters.traits: Gnome Cunning: Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic. Stone Camouflage: Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain. Innate Spellcasting: Can cast nondetection on self at will, blindness/deafness and blur once per day each.
monsters.actions: War Pick: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 piercing. Poisoned Dart: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d4+2 piercing plus target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. Heavy Crossbow: +4 to hit, range 100/400 ft., 1d10+2 piercing.

monsters.name: Giant Centipede
monsters.description: Giant centipedes are segmented arthropods that can grow to be four feet long. They scuttle through dark tunnels and crevices on dozens of chitinous legs, hunting smaller creatures with their venomous bite. Their bodies are dark brown or black with a metallic sheen.
monsters.traits: Blindsight: Can perceive its surroundings without relying on sight within 30 feet. Climb: Has a climbing speed equal to its walking speed.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing plus 3d6 poison damage. Target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking half damage on a success. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned and paralyzed for 1 hour.

monsters.name: Mushroom Folk
monsters.description: Mushroom folk are fungal humanoids that grow in the deepest caverns where no sunlight ever reaches. They appear as walking mushrooms with cap-like heads and stalk-like bodies. These peaceful creatures communicate through releasing spores and tend to underground fungal gardens.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from a normal large mushroom. Spore Communication: Can communicate with other fungi within 30 feet through spore releases.
monsters.actions: Fist: +2 to hit, 1d4 bludgeoning. Spore Cloud: Releases spores in a 10-foot radius. Each creature in the area must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. The spores also create lightly obscured conditions in the area for 1 minute.

monsters.name: Cave Troll
monsters.description: Cave trolls are smaller cousins of the more common trolls, adapted for life in cramped underground spaces. Their skin is mottled gray and black like cave stone, and they have developed keen senses for hunting in complete darkness. Unlike their surface kin, they cannot regenerate but are more resilient to fire.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Stone Camouflage: Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in rocky terrain.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes three attacks: one bite and two claws. Bite: +7 to hit, 1d6+4 piercing. Claw: +7 to hit, 1d6+4 slashing. Rock: +7 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d8+4 bludgeoning.

monsters.name: Crystal Crawler
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
monsters.description: Crystal crawlers are artificial creatures made from enchanted gems and crystals found deep underground. They skitter on multiple crystalline legs and their bodies refract light in dazzling patterns. Created by ancient civilizations to guard treasure vaults, some still patrol forgotten ruins.
monsters.traits: Crystal Body: When the crawler takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage from crystal shards. Light Reflection: In bright light, attacks against the crawler have disadvantage.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two claw attacks. Claw: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing plus 1d4 piercing. Prismatic Flash: Creates bright light in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 round (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Duergar Warrior
monsters.description: Duergar, also known as gray dwarves, are the evil cousins of surface dwarves who dwell in the deepest parts of the Underdark. They have ashen skin and hair, and their eyes burn with malevolent intelligence. These warriors serve their clan with grim determination and cunning tactics.
monsters.traits: Duergar Resilience: Advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions. Sunlight Sensitivity: While in sunlight, has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks. Duergar Magic: Can cast enlarge/reduce and invisibility on self once per day each.
monsters.actions: War Pick: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 piercing. Javelin: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d6+2 piercing. Heavy Crossbow: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., 1d10 piercing. Enlarge (1/Day): Doubles in size for 1 minute, advantage on Strength checks and saves, +1d4 damage on weapon attacks.

monsters.name: Violet Fungus
monsters.description: Violet fungi are dangerous plant creatures that grow in the darkest depths of caves and dungeons. They appear as large purple mushrooms with writhing tendrils that can rot flesh on contact. These sessile predators wait patiently for prey to come within reach of their deadly appendages.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus. Rotting Touch: Creature hit by tentacle attack must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or flesh begins to rot, taking 1d4 necrotic damage at the start of each turn for 1 minute.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes 1d4 tentacle attacks. Rotting Touch: +2 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d8 necrotic damage plus rotting effect (see traits).

monsters.name: Hook Horror
monsters.senses: Blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 13
monsters.description: Hook horrors are bizarre bipedal creatures with vulture-like heads and massive hooks instead of hands. They stand eight feet tall and communicate through a series of clicking and clacking sounds that echo through cave systems. These creatures are surprisingly intelligent and often work together in hunting packs.
monsters.traits: Echolocation: Can't use blindsight while deafened. Keen Hearing: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. Pack Tactics: Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one ally is within 5 feet of the creature.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two hook attacks. Hook: +6 to hit, 2d6+4 piercing. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 14). The hook horror has two hooks, each of which can grapple only one target. Echoing Shriek: Emits a piercing shriek. Each creature within 30 feet must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be deafened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Deepling Cultist
monsters.description: Deepling cultists are surface dwellers who have spent so long in the depths that they have begun to change. Their skin has taken on a pale, translucent quality, and their eyes have grown large and dark. They worship aberrant entities from the Far Realm and seek to bring their alien influence to the surface world.
monsters.traits: Madness: Immune to being frightened. When reduced to half hit points or lower, gains advantage on attack rolls but disadvantage on ability checks. Aberrant Patron: Can communicate telepathically with aberrations within 60 feet.
monsters.actions: Scimitar: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Eldritch Blast: +5 spell attack, range 120 ft., 1d10+3 force damage. Cause Fear: Target within 60 feet must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute (3/day). Arms of Hadar: Tendrils erupt in 10-foot radius, DC 13 Strength save or 2d6 necrotic damage and restrained for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Tribal Warrior
monsters.description: Tribal warriors are members of nomadic or isolated communities who have learned to fight with primitive weapons and guerrilla tactics. They wear hide armor decorated with tribal markings and carry weapons crafted from stone, bone, and wood. These fierce fighters defend their people and ancestral lands with unwavering courage.
monsters.traits: Pack Tactics: Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one ally is within 5 feet of the creature. Primitive Weapons: Proficient with simple weapons and improvised weapons made from natural materials.
monsters.actions: Spear: +3 to hit, 1d6+1 piercing (or 1d8+1 if used two-handed). Handaxe: +3 to hit, 1d6+1 slashing. Javelin: +1 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d6+1 piercing. War Cry: All allies within 30 feet gain advantage on their next attack roll (1/day).

monsters.name: Mercenary Crossbow Expert
monsters.description: Mercenary crossbow experts are professional soldiers who specialize in ranged combat. They wear studded leather armor and carry finely crafted crossbows with specialized ammunition. These disciplined fighters sell their services to the highest bidder and are known for their accuracy and tactical awareness.
monsters.traits: Crossbow Expert: Ignores loading property of crossbows and can fire in melee without disadvantage. Sharpshooter: Can take -5 penalty to attack roll for +10 damage.
monsters.actions: Heavy Crossbow: +5 to hit, range 100/400 ft., 1d10+3 piercing. Shortsword: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 piercing. Special Bolt: Once per day can fire a bolt that deals an extra 1d6 damage and has a special effect (poison, fire, or entangling). Aimed Shot: Spends action to gain advantage on next crossbow attack.

monsters.name: Desert Nomad
monsters.description: Desert nomads are hardy people who have adapted to life in the harshest environments. They wear flowing robes that protect them from sand and sun, and their weathered faces show the wisdom of those who understand the desert's moods. These skilled survivors know every oasis and hidden water source.
monsters.traits: Desert Adaptation: Resistance to fire damage and doesn't require as much water. Heat Resistance: Advantage on Constitution saves against extreme heat. Mounted Combatant: Advantage on attacks against unmounted creatures while mounted.
monsters.actions: Scimitar: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Composite Bow: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., 1d8+2 piercing. Net: +4 to hit, range 5/15 ft., target is restrained (DC 10 to escape). Desert Knowledge: Can locate water sources and predict sandstorms.

monsters.name: Pirate Deckhand
monsters.description: Pirate deckhands are rough sailors who make their living through raiding and plunder on the high seas. They wear salt-stained clothing and carry cutlasses and daggers. These hardy seafarers are equally at home climbing rigging in a storm or boarding an enemy vessel in combat.
monsters.traits: Sea Legs: Immune to seasickness and has advantage on ability checks related to sailing and ships. Dirty Fighting: When an enemy is surprised or flanked, deals +1d4 damage on weapon attacks.
monsters.actions: Cutlass: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Dagger: +3 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d4+1 piercing. Boarding Hook: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d4+2 piercing and can pull Medium or smaller creatures 5 feet closer. Grappling Hook: Can be used to climb or swing between ships.

monsters.name: Mountain Berserker
monsters.description: Mountain berserkers are fierce warriors from highland clans who enter battle-rage when fighting. They wear furs and leather armor adorned with the bones and teeth of defeated foes. These wild fighters live in harsh mountain peaks where only the strongest survive.
monsters.traits: Rage: As a bonus action, enters rage for 1 minute (1/day). While raging, has advantage on Strength checks and saves, +2 melee damage, and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Mountain Born: Acclimated to high altitude and extreme cold.
monsters.actions: Greataxe: +5 to hit, 1d12+3 slashing (1d12+5 while raging). Handaxe: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d6+3 slashing (1d6+5 while raging). Reckless Attack: Gains advantage on all melee attacks until start of next turn, but attacks against the berserker have advantage.

monsters.name: Cult Fanatic
monsters.description: Cult fanatics are zealous devotees who have dedicated their lives to serving dark powers or twisted ideologies. They wear robes marked with blasphemous symbols and speak in fervent whispers about their unholy cause. These dangerous individuals will stop at nothing to further their cult's goals.
monsters.traits: Dark Devotion: Advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Fanatical Loyalty: Will fight to the death and cannot be swayed from their beliefs. Spellcasting: 4th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks.
monsters.actions: Dagger: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing. Light Crossbow: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., 1d8+2 piercing. Spells: Cantrips (3): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy. 1st level (4): command, inflict wounds, shield of faith. 2nd level (3): hold person, spiritual weapon. Dark Blessing: Grants ally within 30 feet +1d4 to next attack or save (3/day).

monsters.name: Elite Guard
monsters.description: Elite guards are professional soldiers who protect important nobles, merchants, or institutions. They wear polished plate armor bearing the insignia of their employer and carry high-quality weapons. These disciplined warriors have extensive training in both individual combat and formation fighting.
monsters.traits: Formation Fighting: When standing adjacent to another guard, both gain +1 AC. Protection: Can use reaction to impose disadvantage on attacks against nearby allies. Trained Professional: Advantage on saves against being frightened.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two longsword attacks. Longsword: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 slashing (or 1d10+3 if used two-handed). Heavy Crossbow: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., 1d10+1 piercing. Shield Bash: +5 to hit, 1d4+3 bludgeoning, target must make DC 13 Strength save or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Witch Doctor
monsters.description: Witch doctors are tribal spellcasters who blend divine magic with ancient shamanic traditions. They wear elaborate masks and ritual garments decorated with bones, feathers, and mystical symbols. These wise healers serve as both spiritual guides and protectors of their communities.
monsters.traits: Ritual Casting: Can cast spells with the ritual tag without expending spell slots. Spiritual Guide: Can communicate with spirits and ancestors for guidance. Spellcasting: 5th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks.
monsters.actions: Quarterstaff: +1 to hit, 1d6-1 bludgeoning (or 1d8-1 if used two-handed). Poison Dart: +4 to hit, range 25/100 ft., 1d4+2 piercing plus DC 12 Constitution save or poisoned for 1 hour. Spells: Cantrips (4): guidance, poison spray, resistance, thaumaturgy. 1st level (4): bane, cure wounds, detect poison and disease. 2nd level (3): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon. 3rd level (2): dispel magic, spirit guardians. Hex Curse: Target within 60 feet has disadvantage on ability checks using one ability score for 1 hour (1/day).

monsters.name: Assassin Acolyte
monsters.languages: Common, Thieves' Cant plus one other
monsters.description: Assassin acolytes are skilled killers who have trained in the deadly arts of stealth and murder. They wear dark, form-fitting clothing that allows for silent movement and carry an array of specialized weapons and poisons. These ruthless professionals eliminate targets with cold efficiency.
monsters.traits: Assassinate: Advantage on attack rolls against creatures that haven't taken a turn yet. Any hit against a surprised creature is a critical hit. Sneak Attack: Once per turn, deals +2d6 damage with weapon attacks when having advantage. Poison Use: Proficient with poison and immune to accidental poisoning.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two shortsword attacks or two dagger attacks. Shortsword: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 piercing plus 1d4 poison damage. Poisoned Dagger: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d4+3 piercing plus DC 13 Constitution save or take 2d4 poison damage and be poisoned for 1 minute. Smoke Bomb: Creates heavily obscured 15-foot radius area for 1 minute (1/day). Poison Kit: Can apply contact poison to weapons or create inhaled toxins.

monsters.name: War Priest Initiate
monsters.description: War priest initiates are militant clerics who serve deities of war, conquest, or justice. They wear heavy armor emblazoned with holy symbols and wield blessed weapons in righteous combat. These warrior-priests combine martial prowess with divine magic to smite their enemies.
monsters.traits: Divine Strike: Weapon attacks deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage. War Domain: Proficient with martial weapons and heavy armor. Spellcasting: 5th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two warhammer attacks. Warhammer: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 bludgeoning plus 1d8 radiant damage. Heavy Crossbow: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., 1d10 piercing. Spells: Cantrips (4): guidance, light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy. 1st level (4): divine favor, guiding bolt, healing word, shield of faith. 2nd level (3): magic weapon, spiritual weapon. 3rd level (2): dispel magic, spirit guardians. Channel Divinity: Turn Undead or War God's Blessing (+10 to attack roll, 1/day).

monsters.name: Pirate Gunner
monsters.description: Pirate gunners are specialists in naval artillery who operate the cannons and firearms aboard pirate vessels. They wear practical clothing stained with gunpowder and carry an assortment of firearms and tools. These experienced sailors know how to reload under pressure and can hit targets even in rough seas.
monsters.traits: Sea Legs: Immune to seasickness and has advantage on ability checks related to sailing and ships. Gunpowder Expert: Proficient with firearms and explosive devices. Can reload firearms as a bonus action.
monsters.actions: Cutlass: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 slashing. Musket: +5 to hit, range 40/120 ft., 1d12+3 piercing. Loading property, but can reload as bonus action. Pistol: +5 to hit, range 30/90 ft., 1d10+3 piercing. Loading property. Explosive Charge: Throws a small bomb, range 20/60 ft., 10-foot radius, DC 13 Dex save or 2d6 fire damage (1/day). Covering Fire: Allies within 30 feet gain half cover against ranged attacks until start of gunner's next turn.

monsters.name: Pirate Bosun
monsters.description: Pirate bosuns are experienced officers who maintain discipline aboard ship and lead boarding parties during raids. They wear salt-stained leather armor and carry well-maintained weapons. These tough veterans command respect through a combination of seamanship skills and brutal efficiency in combat.
monsters.traits: Sea Legs: Immune to seasickness and has advantage on ability checks related to sailing and ships. Leadership: Allied pirates within 30 feet can add the bosun's Charisma modifier to damage rolls. Ship's Discipline: Can end one fear or charm effect on an ally within 30 feet as a bonus action.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two scimitar attacks or one scimitar and one whip attack. Scimitar: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 slashing. Whip: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d4+3 slashing. If target is Medium or smaller, it must make a DC 13 Strength save or be knocked prone. Boarding Hook: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d6+3 piercing and pulls target 5 feet closer. Rally Crew: All allied pirates within 30 feet gain advantage on their next attack roll.

monsters.name: Sea Witch
monsters.description: Sea witches are spellcasters who have made pacts with oceanic powers or learned to harness the magic of storms and tides. They wear flowing robes that seem to move like water and carry staffs adorned with coral and shells. These mysterious figures can summon sea creatures and control the weather.
monsters.traits: Amphibious: Can breathe air and water. Spellcasting: 5th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks. Storm Sense: Can predict weather changes and has advantage on saves against weather effects.
monsters.actions: Dagger: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing. Trident: +2 to hit, 1d6 piercing (or 1d8 if used two-handed). Spells: Cantrips (4): eldritch blast, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shape water. 1st level (4): charm person, fog cloud, thunderwave. 2nd level (3): gust of wind, misty step, suggestion. 3rd level (2): call lightning, water breathing. Summon Sea Creature: Calls forth a reef shark or giant octopus that serves for 1 hour (1/day). Tidal Wave: Creates a 30-foot line of water, DC 13 Dex save or 3d8 bludgeoning damage and knocked prone (1/day).

monsters.name: Pirate Captain
monsters.description: Pirate captains are charismatic leaders who command both ship and crew through a combination of tactical brilliance, personal magnetism, and ruthless determination. They wear fine clothing taken from wealthy victims and carry enchanted weapons. These legendary figures inspire both fear and loyalty on the high seas.
monsters.traits: Sea Legs: Immune to seasickness and has advantage on ability checks related to sailing and ships. Legendary Resistance (1/Day): If the captain fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. Action Surge: Can take an additional action on its turn (recharges after a short or long rest). Inspiring Presence: Allies within 30 feet add +2 to attack rolls and saving throws.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes three attacks with rapier or pistol in any combination. Rapier: +6 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing. Pistol: +6 to hit, range 30/90 ft., 1d10+3 piercing. Parry: Adds +3 AC against one melee attack (reaction). Command: Issues an order that allows an ally within 60 feet to make an attack as a reaction. Intimidating Shout: All enemies within 30 feet must make a DC 15 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Ghostly Pirate
monsters.damage_resistances: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained
monsters.description: Ghostly pirates are the spectral remains of seafaring raiders who died with unfinished business or treasure left buried. They appear as translucent figures in tattered naval clothing, forever bound to their ship or the location of their demise. These restless spirits seek to complete their final voyage or protect their hidden wealth.
monsters.traits: Ethereal Sight: Can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane. Incorporeal Movement: Can move through objects and creatures as if they were difficult terrain, takes 1d10 force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. Unfinished Business: Cannot be permanently destroyed until its earthly concerns are resolved.
monsters.actions: Spectral Cutlass: +5 to hit, 2d6+3 necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by the damage taken. Horrifying Visage: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet that can see the ghost must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6). Possession: Attempts to possess a humanoid within 5 feet, DC 13 Charisma save or possessed for 24 hours (1/day). Ethereal Jaunt: Enters the Ethereal Plane until the start of its next turn.

monsters.name: Dungeon Scavenger
monsters.description: Dungeon scavengers are desperate individuals who make their living by looting abandoned ruins and forgotten chambers. They wear patched leather armor and carry an assortment of tools for breaking into locked areas. These survivors have learned to navigate the dangers of ancient dungeons through cunning and caution.
monsters.traits: Trap Sense: Advantage on Perception checks to detect traps and Dexterity saves to avoid them. Scavenging: Can find useful items in dungeon rooms (rope, torches, rations) with a successful Investigation check.
monsters.actions: Dagger: +3 to hit, 1d4+1 piercing. Sling: +3 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d4+1 bludgeoning. Crowbar: +2 to hit, 1d4 bludgeoning. Can be used to pry open doors or chests. Caltrops: Scatters spikes in a 5-foot square, creatures moving through take 1d4 piercing damage and speed reduced by 10 feet.

monsters.name: Tomb Guardian
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
monsters.languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
monsters.description: Tomb guardians are ancient constructs created to protect burial chambers and sacred sites. They appear as humanoid figures carved from stone, often depicting warriors or priests in ceremonial pose. When intruders approach, these silent sentinels animate with grinding stone movements to defend their charges.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from a normal statue. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Sacred Duty: Cannot be charmed or compelled to leave the area it guards.
monsters.actions: Slam: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 bludgeoning. Stone Throw: +1 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d6+3 bludgeoning. Guardian's Challenge: Forces one creature within 30 feet to make a DC 12 Wisdom save or be compelled to attack only the guardian for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Corridor Creeper
monsters.description: Corridor creepers are unsettling aberrations that skulk through dungeon passages, feeding on magical residue and organic matter. They have elongated limbs that allow them to move along walls and ceilings, and their skin constantly shifts between different textures and colors for camouflage.
monsters.traits: Spider Climb: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without ability checks. Camouflage: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while pressed against walls or in corners. Magic Eater: Regains 1d4 hit points when a spell is cast within 30 feet.
monsters.actions: Claw: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Drain Touch: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 necrotic damage and target must make a DC 11 Constitution save or have maximum hit points reduced by damage taken until next long rest. Ceiling Drop: If climbing on ceiling, can drop onto creature below as a surprise attack with advantage.

monsters.name: Dungeon Wraith
monsters.damage_resistances: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained
monsters.description: Dungeon wraiths are the tormented spirits of adventurers who died in forgotten chambers, their souls bound to the very stones that witnessed their demise. They appear as ghostly figures in tattered armor, forever seeking to share their fate with new victims who dare to explore their domain.
monsters.traits: Incorporeal Movement: Can move through objects and creatures as difficult terrain, takes 1d10 force damage if ends turn inside object. Dungeon Bound: Cannot move more than 120 feet from the room where it died. Life Drain Aura: Living creatures starting their turn within 15 feet take 1d4 necrotic damage.
monsters.actions: Life Drain: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 necrotic damage and target's maximum hit points are reduced by the damage taken. Wailing Lament: Each creature within 30 feet must make a DC 12 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6). Phase Through: Becomes incorporeal until start of next turn, can move through walls and objects.

monsters.name: Mimic Chest
monsters.description: Mimic chests are shapeshifting predators that perfectly imitate treasure chests to lure unsuspecting victims. When closed, they are indistinguishable from normal containers, but when feeding time arrives, they reveal rows of sharp teeth and a long, sticky tongue. These cunning hunters are patient enough to wait years for the perfect meal.
monsters.traits: Shapechanger: Can use action to polymorph into a chest or back to true form. Equipment it wears or carries isn't transformed. False Appearance: While motionless in chest form, is indistinguishable from an ordinary chest. Adhesive: Objects that touch the mimic are stuck to it (DC 13 Strength check to pull free).
monsters.actions: Pseudopod: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 bludgeoning. If target is stuck to mimic, this attack automatically hits. Bite: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing plus 1d8 acid damage. Can only bite creatures stuck to it. Adhesive Tongue: +5 to hit, reach 20 ft., 1d6+3 bludgeoning and target is stuck to mimic and pulled adjacent to it. Treasure Lure: While in chest form, creatures within 60 feet must make DC 12 Wisdom save or be compelled to approach and touch it.

monsters.name: Living Statue
monsters.damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
monsters.description: Living statues are works of art given consciousness through powerful enchantments. They typically depict heroic figures, mythical creatures, or ancient gods carved from marble or granite. These elegant guardians move with surprising grace despite their stone composition, defending their creators' sanctuaries with artistic precision.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from a normal statue. Immutable Form: Immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form. Artistic Memory: Perfectly remembers the appearance and voices of all creatures it has encountered.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two slam attacks. Slam: +6 to hit, 2d6+4 bludgeoning. Stone Gaze: Target within 30 feet must make a DC 13 Constitution save or be restrained by stone growths for 1 minute (recharge 5-6). Inspiring Pose: All allies within 30 feet gain advantage on their next attack roll or saving throw (1/day).

monsters.name: Dungeon Lurker
monsters.senses: Blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 14
monsters.description: Dungeon lurkers are predatory aberrations that have adapted perfectly to underground environments. They have multiple eyes that can see in complete darkness, flexible limbs that allow them to navigate tight spaces, and an uncanny ability to remain perfectly still for hours while waiting for prey to pass by.
monsters.traits: Ambush Predator: Has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that haven't taken a turn in combat yet. Squeeze: Can move through spaces as narrow as 2.5 feet without penalty. Patient Hunter: Can take the Hide action as a bonus action while in dim light or darkness.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes three attacks: one bite and two claws. Bite: +6 to hit, 1d10+3 piercing. Claw: +6 to hit, 1d8+3 slashing. Paralyzing Venom: When bite attack hits, target must make a DC 13 Constitution save or be paralyzed for 1 minute (can repeat save at end of each turn). Ceiling Pounce: If lurker starts turn on ceiling, can drop down onto creature below as part of movement and make bite attack with advantage.

monsters.name: Trapped Spirit
monsters.damage_resistances: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained
monsters.description: Trapped spirits are the souls of individuals bound to specific objects or locations by powerful magic or unfinished business. They appear as translucent figures wreathed in ethereal chains or glowing sigils. Some seek to complete their earthly tasks, while others have been driven mad by centuries of confinement.
monsters.traits: Incorporeal Movement: Can move through objects and creatures as difficult terrain, takes 1d10 force damage if ends turn inside object. Bound: Cannot move more than 60 feet from the object or location to which it is bound. Ethereal Sight: Can see into the Ethereal Plane within 60 feet.
monsters.actions: Draining Touch: +4 to hit, 2d8+2 necrotic damage and target must make a DC 14 Constitution save or have maximum hit points reduced by half the damage taken. Mournful Wail: Each creature within 60 feet must make a DC 14 Wisdom save or be frightened and take 2d6 psychic damage (recharge 5-6). Possession Attempt: Tries to possess a humanoid within 5 feet, DC 14 Charisma save or possessed until the spirit's binding is broken (1/day). Manifest Memory: Shows visions of past events related to its binding to creatures within 30 feet.

monsters.name: Vault Guardian
monsters.damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
monsters.description: Vault guardians are massive constructs specifically designed to protect the most valuable treasures in ancient dungeons. Standing eight feet tall and crafted from enchanted metals, they are covered in protective runes and magical wards. These implacable sentinels will pursue thieves relentlessly until their charges are returned.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Immutable Form: Immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form. Treasure Sense: Knows the exact location of any treasure that has been removed from its vault within the last 24 hours. Antimagic Pulse: When reduced to half hit points, creates an antimagic field in 15-foot radius for 1 minute (1/day).
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two slam attacks. Slam: +7 to hit, 2d8+5 bludgeoning plus 1d6 force damage. Force Blast: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., 2d10+3 force damage and target is pushed 10 feet away. Restraining Bonds: Magical chains attempt to bind a creature within 30 feet, DC 15 Dexterity save or restrained for 1 minute (recharge 5-6). Alarm: Sends magical alert to creator or other guardians within 1 mile when treasure is threatened.

monsters.name: Ancient Lich's Apprentice
monsters.languages: Common, Abyssal, Draconic plus three others
monsters.description: Ancient lich apprentices are the undead remains of powerful wizards who served mighty liches in ages past. Though not true liches themselves, they retain much of their magical knowledge and ambition. These gaunt figures wear tattered robes that once indicated their high station in their master's hierarchy.
monsters.traits: Spellcasting: 9th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Undead Nature: Doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. Turn Resistance: Advantage on saves against effects that turn undead.
monsters.actions: Withering Touch: +6 to hit, 2d6+3 necrotic damage and target must make a DC 15 Constitution save or age 1d4 years. Spells: Cantrips (4): chill touch, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation. 1st level (4): magic missile, shield. 2nd level (3): misty step, web. 3rd level (3): counterspell, fireball. 4th level (3): greater invisibility, polymorph. 5th level (1): cone of cold. Animate Dead: Raises 2d4 skeletons or zombies from nearby remains to serve for 24 hours (1/day). Lich's Knowledge: Can answer questions about ancient history, forgotten magic, or hidden treasures with perfect accuracy.

monsters.name: Bog Sprite
monsters.description: Bog sprites are tiny fey creatures that inhabit the misty reaches of swamplands. They appear as miniature humanoids with dragonfly wings and skin that shifts between green and brown to match the wetland vegetation. These mischievous beings delight in leading travelers astray with false lights and confusing illusions.
monsters.traits: Swamp Camouflage: Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in swampy terrain. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Marsh Gas: Can create a 5-foot radius cloud of flammable gas that ignites if exposed to fire (1d6 fire damage in area).
monsters.actions: Thorn Dart: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d4+3 piercing plus target must make DC 11 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 minute. Will O' Wisp: Creates a floating light within 60 feet that moves 30 feet per turn and lasts 10 minutes. Creatures following it must make DC 11 Wisdom saves or become lost. Pixie Dust: Throws sparkling dust at target within 15 feet, DC 11 Constitution save or fall asleep for 1 minute.

monsters.name: Swamp Gas
