monsters.condition_immunities: Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained
monsters.description: Swamp gas is a semi-sentient cloud of toxic vapors that rises from decaying organic matter in stagnant wetlands. It appears as a greenish, translucent mist that drifts ominously through the bog. This dangerous phenomenon can ignite explosively when exposed to flame or spark.
monsters.traits: Gaseous Form: Can enter hostile creature's space and stop there. Can move through space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing. Explosive: If takes fire damage, explodes in 15-foot radius. All creatures in area make DC 12 Dexterity save or take 2d6 fire damage. Toxic Aura: Creatures starting turn in same space take 1d4 poison damage.
monsters.actions: Engulf: Moves into a creature's space and the creature must make a DC 11 Constitution save or be poisoned and blinded while in the same space as the gas. Methane Burst: Releases concentrated gas in 10-foot radius, DC 11 Constitution save or poisoned for 1 minute and disadvantage on attack rolls.

monsters.name: Marsh Hag
monsters.description: Marsh hags are ancient fey who have become corrupted by dwelling too long in the darkest corners of swamplands. They appear as withered crones with moss-covered skin and tangled hair that drips with bog water. These cunning creatures make bargains with desperate travelers, always extracting a terrible price.
monsters.traits: Amphibious: Can breathe air and water. Spellcasting: 7th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks. Swamp Walk: Difficult terrain composed of mud, water, or vegetation doesn't cost extra movement. Curse Magic: Spells that inflict curses or negative conditions have +1 to spell save DC.
monsters.actions: Claws: +5 to hit, 2d6+2 slashing plus 1d6 necrotic damage. Bog Water Spit: +5 to hit, range 30 ft., 1d8+3 acid damage and target must make DC 14 Constitution save or be blinded for 1 minute. Spells: Cantrips (4): eldritch blast, minor illusion, poison spray, prestidigitation. 1st level (4): charm person, hex. 2nd level (3): hold person, misty step. 3rd level (3): counterspell, bestow curse. 4th level (1): polymorph. Hag's Bargain: Offers magical boon in exchange for service or sacrifice (complex negotiation).

monsters.name: Crocodile, Giant
monsters.description: Giant crocodiles are massive reptilian predators that can grow to over 20 feet in length. They lurk in murky swamp waters with only their eyes and nostrils visible above the surface. These patient hunters can remain motionless for hours before exploding into violent action to drag prey underwater.
monsters.traits: Hold Breath: Can hold its breath for 30 minutes. Swamp Camouflage: Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while in water or muddy terrain.
monsters.actions: Bite: +8 to hit, 3d10+5 piercing. If target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity save or be swallowed. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover, and takes 2d6 acid damage at start of each of the crocodile's turns. Tail: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., 2d8+5 bludgeoning and target must make DC 16 Strength save or be knocked prone. Death Roll: If grappling a creature, can use action to automatically deal bite damage and attempt to knock target prone.

monsters.name: Bog Mummy
monsters.damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.description: Bog mummies are the preserved remains of those who died in acidic peat bogs, their bodies naturally mummified by the unique chemistry of the wetlands. Dark magic has animated these ancient corpses, giving them a malevolent intelligence and hunger for the warmth of living flesh.
monsters.traits: Bog Preservation: Body is naturally preserved by peat acids. When destroyed, can reform in the same bog after 24 hours unless the bog is blessed or drained. Acidic Touch: Weapon attacks deal an additional 1d4 acid damage. Bog Walk: Ignores difficult terrain created by mud, water, or marsh vegetation.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two rotting fist attacks. Rotting Fist: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 bludgeoning plus 1d6 acid damage and target must make DC 12 Constitution save or contract bog rot (diseased condition, -1d4 max HP per day until cured). Bog Spores: Releases acidic spores in 15-foot radius, DC 12 Constitution save or take 2d6 acid damage and be poisoned for 1 minute (recharge 5-6). Preserve Corpse: Touches a dead creature to begin mummifying it. After 24 hours, it rises as a bog mummy under this creature's control.

monsters.name: Will O' Wisp
monsters.damage_resistances: Acid, Cold, Fire, Necrotic, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious
monsters.description: Will o' wisps are malevolent spirits that appear as floating orbs of pale light in swamps and marshes. They feed on the life force of living creatures and delight in leading travelers into dangerous bog holes and quicksand. These cunning entities can dim or brighten their light at will to lure victims to their doom.
monsters.traits: Consume Life: Can regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt by its shock attack. Ephemeral: Can't wear or carry anything. Variable Illumination: Sheds bright light in 5 to 20-foot radius and dim light for additional number of feet equal to chosen radius, or no light.
monsters.actions: Shock: +4 to hit, range 60 ft., 2d8+4 lightning damage. Invisibility: Magically turns invisible until it attacks or uses Consume Life, or until its concentration ends. Lure: Creates illusory lights and sounds to lead creatures astray. Creatures within 120 feet must make DC 12 Wisdom save or be charmed and compelled to move toward the wisp by the safest route.

monsters.name: Shambling Mound
monsters.description: Shambling mounds are massive creatures composed of rotting vegetation, moss, and vines animated by primal magic. They stand 8 feet tall and 6 feet wide, constantly shedding plant matter as they move. These silent hunters can remain motionless for days, appearing to be nothing more than a large pile of decomposing plants.
monsters.traits: Lightning Absorption: When subjected to lightning damage, takes no damage and instead regains hit points equal to lightning damage dealt. Swamp Camouflage: Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in swampy terrain.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two slam attacks. If both hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled and the shambling mound uses Engulf. Slam: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., 2d8+4 bludgeoning. Engulf: Grappled creature is engulfed and blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe. Takes 2d8+4 bludgeoning damage at start of each of the mound's turns. Mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

monsters.name: Swamp Troll
monsters.description: Swamp trolls are cousins to their mountain-dwelling kin who have adapted to wetland environments. Their skin has taken on a greenish, moss-covered appearance that helps them blend with the vegetation. Unlike other trolls, they have developed gills and webbed fingers, allowing them to hunt both above and below the waterline.
monsters.traits: Amphibious: Can breathe air and water. Regeneration: Regains 10 hit points at start of its turn. If troll takes acid or fire damage, trait doesn't function at start of next turn. Dies only if it starts turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate. Swamp Camouflage: Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in swampy terrain.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes three attacks: one bite and two claws. Bite: +7 to hit, 1d6+4 piercing. Claw: +7 to hit, 1d6+4 slashing. Acid Spit: +3 to hit, range 30 ft., 2d6 acid damage and target must make DC 15 Constitution save or be blinded for 1 minute. Submerge: Dives underwater and can hold breath for 1 hour. Gains advantage on next attack made from underwater.

monsters.name: Vine Blight
monsters.description: Vine blights are malevolent plant creatures created when dark magic corrupts ordinary swamp vines. They appear as masses of writhing, thorny tendrils that can stretch across considerable distances. These aggressive plants actively hunt living creatures to drain their life force and expand their territory.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from normal vines. Entangling Vines: Difficult terrain extends 10 feet around the blight. When creature starts turn in this area, vines grab at it and creature must make DC 12 Strength save or be restrained until start of next turn.
monsters.actions: Constrict: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., 2d6+2 bludgeoning and target is grappled. Until grapple ends, target is restrained and blight can't constrict another target. Thorn Volley: Shoots thorns in 15-foot cone, DC 12 Dexterity save or take 2d4 piercing damage (recharge 5-6). Vine Whip: +4 to hit, reach 15 ft., 1d6+2 slashing and target must make DC 12 Strength save or be pulled 10 feet closer.

monsters.name: Plague Rat Swarm
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Prone, Restrained, Stunned
monsters.description: Plague rat swarms are collections of diseased rodents that carry virulent illnesses through stagnant swamplands. These mangy creatures have developed resistance to many toxins found in polluted water, but their bites spread dangerous infections. They often follow larger predators to feed on scraps and weakened prey.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Swarm: Can occupy another creature's space and move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. Can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. Disease Carrier: Immune to disease but spreads multiple contagions through bites.
monsters.actions: Bites: +2 to hit, 2d6 piercing, or 1d6 if swarm has half hit points or fewer. Target must make DC 10 Constitution save or contract swamp fever (poisoned condition and -1 to all ability scores until cured by magic or medicine). Diseased Frenzy: When swarm is reduced to half hit points, its movement speed doubles and it gains advantage on attack rolls for 1 minute.

monsters.name: Sea Sprite
monsters.description: Sea sprites are tiny oceanic fey that dance upon wave crests and ride the ocean winds. They appear as miniature humanoids with translucent, blue-green skin and fins instead of wings. These playful creatures delight in guiding lost sailors to safety or playing harmless pranks on crew members during calm weather.
monsters.traits: Amphibious: Can breathe air and water. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Sea Camouflage: Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while in or on water.
monsters.actions: Trident: +1 to hit, 1 piercing. Water Bolt: +6 to hit, range 30 ft., 1d4+4 bludgeoning. Invisibility: Magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell. Call Dolphins: Summons 1d4 dolphins that arrive in 2d4 rounds and are friendly to the sprite for 1 hour (1/day).

monsters.name: Giant Jellyfish
monsters.description: Giant jellyfish are massive cnidarians with bell-shaped bodies that can span 6 feet across. Their long, trailing tentacles are covered in stinging cells that deliver paralyzing toxins. These graceful creatures drift through ocean currents, creating beautiful but deadly underwater displays.
monsters.traits: Transparent: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while underwater. Water Breathing: Can only breathe underwater. Tentacle Reach: Tentacles extend up to 20 feet from the main body.
monsters.actions: Tentacle Sting: +3 to hit, reach 20 ft., 1d6+1 bludgeoning plus 2d4 poison damage. Target must make a DC 12 Constitution save or be paralyzed for 1 minute (can repeat save at end of each turn). Pulse: Creates a current that pushes all creatures within 15 feet 10 feet away from the jellyfish.

monsters.name: Reef Shark
monsters.description: Reef sharks are aggressive predators that patrol coral reefs and shallow coastal waters. These sleek hunters have powerful jaws filled with razor-sharp teeth and an acute sense of smell that allows them to detect blood from great distances. They are territorial and will attack anything they perceive as a threat.
monsters.traits: Blood Frenzy: Has advantage on melee attack rolls against creatures that don't have all their hit points. Pack Tactics: Has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one ally is within 5 feet of the creature. Water Breathing: Can only breathe underwater.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 piercing. If the target is a creature, it must make a DC 11 Constitution save or begin bleeding. While bleeding, the creature takes 1d4 damage at the start of each turn until it receives magical healing or someone uses an action to staunch the wound.

monsters.name: Merfolk Warrior
monsters.description: Merfolk warriors are the defenders of underwater kingdoms and coral cities. They have the upper body of a human and the tail of a fish, with scales that shimmer in blues and greens. These proud aquatic humanoids wield tridents and spears, using their superior swimming ability to outmaneuver surface dwellers.
monsters.traits: Amphibious: Can breathe air and water. Underwater Advantage: Has advantage on attack rolls while completely underwater against creatures that cannot breathe water.
monsters.actions: Trident: +3 to hit, 1d6+1 piercing (or 1d8+1 if used two-handed). Net: +4 to hit, range 5/15 ft., target is restrained (DC 10 to escape). Spear: +3 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d6+1 piercing. Conch Horn: Calls for aid, summoning 1d4 other merfolk who arrive in 1d6 rounds.

monsters.name: Sahuagin Raider
monsters.description: Sahuagin raiders are savage shark-like humanoids who terrorize coastal settlements and merchant vessels. They have gray-green scales, sharp teeth, and black eyes that reflect their predatory nature. These aggressive warriors work together in organized raids, using their ability to speak with sharks to coordinate devastating attacks.
monsters.traits: Blood Frenzy: Has advantage on melee attack rolls against creatures that don't have all their hit points. Limited Amphibiousness: Can breathe air and water, but needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours or begins to suffocate. Shark Telepathy: Can magically command any shark within 120 feet.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two melee attacks: one bite and one claws or spear. Bite: +3 to hit, 1d4+1 piercing. Claws: +3 to hit, 1d4+1 slashing. Spear: +3 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d6+1 piercing. Shark Call: Summons 1d2 reef sharks that arrive in 1d4 rounds and serve for 1 hour (1/day).

monsters.name: Sea Hag
monsters.description: Sea hags are hideous oceanic fey with barnacle-encrusted skin, stringy seaweed hair, and yellowed fangs. They dwell in underwater caves or shipwrecks, delighting in drowning sailors and corrupting pure waters. These malevolent creatures can assume more pleasing forms to lure victims to watery graves.
monsters.traits: Amphibious: Can breathe air and water. Horrific Appearance: When a humanoid that can see the hag starts its turn within 30 feet, the hag can force it to make a DC 11 Wisdom save if the hag isn't incapacitated. On a failure, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn.
monsters.actions: Claws: +4 to hit, 2d6+3 slashing. Death Glare: Targets a frightened creature within 30 feet. Target must make a DC 11 Wisdom save or drop to 0 hit points. Illusory Appearance: Covers self and equipment with magical illusion, appearing as another creature of similar size for 1 hour. Physical interaction reveals the illusion. Drowning Curse: Target within 60 feet must make DC 11 Constitution save or begin drowning even if they can breathe water, lasting until curse is removed.

monsters.name: Giant Octopus
monsters.description: Giant octopi are highly intelligent cephalopods with eight powerful tentacles covered in suction cups. They can grow to have an arm span of 20 feet and are master ambush predators. These creatures are known for their problem-solving abilities and can squeeze through surprisingly small openings.
monsters.traits: Hold Breath: Can hold its breath for 1 hour. Underwater Camouflage: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while underwater. Water Breathing: Can only breathe underwater.
monsters.actions: Tentacles: +5 to hit, reach 15 ft., 1d6+3 bludgeoning. If target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 16) and restrained until grapple ends. Octopus can grapple up to two creatures at once. Ink Cloud: While underwater, creates a 20-foot radius cloud of ink. Area is heavily obscured for 1 minute or until dispersed by current. Octopus can dash as bonus action after using this ability.

monsters.name: Storm Petrel Swarm
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Prone, Restrained, Stunned
monsters.description: Storm petrel swarms are flocks of seabirds that gather in massive numbers during oceanic storms. These small, dark birds are considered omens of bad weather by sailors. When threatened or protecting their feeding grounds, they attack in coordinated diving formations that can overwhelm even large vessels.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. Storm Sense: Can predict weather changes up to 24 hours in advance. Swarm: Can occupy another creature's space and move through any opening large enough for a Small bird. Can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.
monsters.actions: Beaks: +4 to hit, 2d6 piercing, or 1d6 if swarm has half hit points or fewer. Diving Attack: If swarm moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and hits with beaks, deals extra 1d6 damage. Storm Call: Signals an approaching storm. Weather becomes increasingly rough over next 2d6 hours (1/day).

monsters.name: Water Elemental
monsters.damage_resistances: Acid; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious
monsters.description: Water elementals are living embodiments of the ocean's power, appearing as vaguely humanoid forms composed entirely of flowing seawater. They can shift between solid and liquid states at will, making them nearly impossible to contain. These primordial beings are often summoned to serve powerful sea witches or aquatic rulers.
monsters.traits: Water Form: Can enter hostile creature's space and stop there. Can move through space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing. Freeze: If elemental takes cold damage, partially freezes and speed is reduced by 20 feet until end of its next turn.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two slam attacks. Slam: +7 to hit, 2d8+4 bludgeoning. Whelm: Each creature in elemental's space must make DC 15 Strength save. On failure, creature takes 2d8+4 bludgeoning damage and is engulfed. On success, creature is pushed out of elemental's space. Engulfed creatures are blinded, restrained, can't breathe, and take 2d8+4 bludgeoning at start of each turn. Tidal Wave: Creates 30-foot line of water, DC 15 Dexterity save or 4d8 bludgeoning damage and knocked prone (recharge 4-6).

monsters.name: Kraken Spawn
monsters.description: Kraken spawn are the juvenile offspring of the legendary kraken, though still formidable creatures in their own right. They possess multiple writhing tentacles, intelligent eyes, and the ability to generate electrical storms. These creatures often serve as heralds or agents of their ancient parent, terrorizing shipping lanes and coastal settlements.
monsters.traits: Amphibious: Can breathe air and water. Freedom of Movement: Ignores difficult terrain and magical effects can't reduce speed or cause paralysis or restraint. Tentacle Regeneration: If a tentacle is severed, regrows it in 1d4 rounds.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes four tentacle attacks or two tentacle attacks and one bite. Tentacle: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., 1d8+5 bludgeoning plus 1d4 lightning damage. If target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 16). Bite: +8 to hit, 2d6+5 piercing. Lightning Storm: Creates storm in 60-foot radius centered on self. All creatures in area take 3d6 lightning damage, DC 14 Dexterity save for half (recharge 5-6). Ink Cloud: Underwater only, creates 60-foot radius cloud of magical darkness for 1 minute.

monsters.name: Dust Devil
monsters.condition_immunities: Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious
monsters.description: Dust devils are minor air elementals that manifest as whirling columns of sand and debris. They dance across desert plains and open grasslands, picking up loose material and creating small sandstorms. While not malicious, these chaotic creatures can be dangerous to travelers caught in their path.
monsters.traits: Sand Form: Can move through spaces occupied by other creatures without penalty. Creatures starting their turn in the same space take 1d4 bludgeoning damage from flying debris. Whirlwind Movement: Movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.
monsters.actions: Slam: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 bludgeoning plus target must make DC 12 Strength save or be knocked prone. Dust Cloud: Creates 15-foot radius area of swirling dust that is lightly obscured for 1 minute. Creatures in area must make DC 12 Constitution save or be blinded for 1 round. Debris Storm: Hurls sand and rocks in 20-foot cone, DC 12 Dexterity save or 2d4 bludgeoning damage (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Ice Mephit
monsters.description: Ice mephits are small, impish elementals composed of living ice and frost. They have crystalline wings and leave trails of snow wherever they fly. These mischievous creatures delight in creating icy hazards and playing pranks on warm-blooded creatures, though their magic can turn deadly in large numbers.
monsters.traits: Death Burst: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of jagged ice. Each creature within 5 feet must make a DC 11 Dexterity save or take 1d8 cold damage. False Appearance: While motionless, appears to be an ordinary ice formation.
monsters.actions: Claws: +3 to hit, 1d4+1 slashing plus 1d4 cold damage. Frost Breath (Recharge 6): Exhales freezing air in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in area must make a DC 10 Dexterity save or take 1d8 cold damage and have speed reduced by 10 feet until end of next turn. Ice Slick: Creates a 10-foot square of slippery ice. Creatures entering area must make DC 10 Dexterity save or fall prone.

monsters.name: Lizardfolk Shaman
monsters.description: Lizardfolk shamans are the spiritual leaders of their tribes, serving as healers, advisors, and keepers of ancient traditions. They wear elaborate headdresses made from crocodile skulls and colorful feathers, and their scales are often painted with tribal symbols. These wise reptilians can speak with beasts and command the forces of nature.
monsters.traits: Hold Breath: Can hold breath for 15 minutes. Spellcasting: 4th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks. Cunning Artisan: Can craft simple weapons and tools from bones and natural materials during short rests.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claws, or casts a spell and makes one weapon attack. Bite: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing. Claws: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 slashing. Javelin: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d6+2 piercing. Spells: Cantrips (4): druidcraft, guidance, produce flame, resistance. 1st level (4): cure wounds, entangle, fog cloud. 2nd level (3): barkskin, hold person, spike growth. Ritual Magic: Can cast detect magic, speak with animals, and augury as rituals.

monsters.name: Phase Spider
monsters.description: Phase spiders are magical arachnids that can shift between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane at will. They appear as large spiders with a faint, shimmering outline that flickers in and out of visibility. These cunning predators use their phasing ability to ambush prey and escape danger.
monsters.traits: Ethereal Jaunt: As a bonus action, can magically shift from Material Plane to Ethereal Plane or vice versa. Spider Climb: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without ability checks. Web Walker: Ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d10+2 piercing plus 1d4 poison damage. Target must make a DC 11 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 minute. If save fails by 5 or more, target is unconscious while poisoned. Web (Recharge 5-6): +4 to hit, range 30/60 ft., target is restrained by webbing. DC 12 Strength check to burst free, AC 10, 5 HP, vulnerable to fire. Phase Ambush: While on Ethereal Plane, can see into Material Plane and attack creatures there with surprise.

monsters.name: Flame Skull
monsters.languages: Common plus up to four others
monsters.description: Flame skulls are the burning remains of powerful wizards or clerics who bound their souls to their skulls through dark rituals. They appear as floating humanoid skulls wreathed in green or blue flames. These undead spellcasters retain much of their magical knowledge and serve as guardians of ancient tombs or repositories of arcane lore.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Rejuvenation: If destroyed, reforms in 1 hour with full hit points unless holy water is sprinkled on its remains or a dispel magic spell is cast on them. Spellcasting: 5th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks. Illumination: Sheds bright light in 15-foot radius and dim light for additional 15 feet.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Can cast a spell and make a bite attack, or make two bite attacks. Bite: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing plus 1d8 fire damage. Spells: Cantrips (3): mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation. 1st level (4): magic missile, shield. 2nd level (3): blur, scorching ray. 3rd level (2): fireball. Fire Ray: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., 2d6+3 fire damage (at will).

monsters.name: Manticore Cub
monsters.description: Manticore cubs are the young offspring of the fearsome manticore, possessing a human-like head, lion's body, and scorpion tail. Though smaller than their parents, they are still dangerous predators with developing tail spikes and a hunger for humanoid flesh. Their intelligence makes them cunning hunters despite their youth.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Tail Spike Regrowth: Regrows 1d4 tail spikes after a long rest, up to maximum of 12.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claw, or three tail spike attacks. Bite: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing. Claw: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 slashing. Tail Spike: +5 to hit, range 80/160 ft., 1d6+3 piercing. Pounce: If moves at least 20 feet toward target and hits with claw attack, target must make DC 12 Strength save or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Magma Mephit
monsters.description: Magma mephits are small elementals formed from molten rock and volcanic gases. They have rough, blackened skin that glows with internal heat and small wings that drip with lava. These aggressive creatures inhabit volcanic regions and delight in setting things ablaze with their fiery breath.
monsters.traits: Death Burst: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of lava. Each creature within 5 feet must make a DC 11 Dexterity save or take 1d8 fire damage. False Appearance: While motionless, appears to be an ordinary lava rock.
monsters.actions: Claws: +3 to hit, 1d4+1 slashing plus 1d4 fire damage. Fire Breath (Recharge 6): Exhales a 15-foot cone of fire. Each creature in area must make a DC 11 Dexterity save or take 2d6 fire damage. Lava Pool: Creates a 5-foot square pool of lava that lasts 1 minute. Creatures entering area take 1d6 fire damage.

monsters.name: Centaur Scout
monsters.description: Centaur scouts are the outriders and pathfinders of centaur communities, ranging far from their woodland homes to gather information and watch for threats. They combine the torso and head of a human with the body of a horse, giving them incredible speed and endurance. These noble creatures are skilled with both bow and spear.
monsters.traits: Charge: If moves at least 30 feet toward a target and hits with pike attack, target takes extra 1d10 piercing damage. Fey Ancestry: Advantage on saves against being charmed, and magic can't put the centaur to sleep.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one pike and one hooves, or two longbow attacks. Pike: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d10+4 piercing. Longbow: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., 1d8+2 piercing. Hooves: +6 to hit, 2d6+4 bludgeoning (only against prone targets). Woodland Knowledge: Can track creatures and navigate through natural terrain without error.

monsters.name: Spectral Warrior
monsters.damage_resistances: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained
monsters.languages: Any languages it knew in life
monsters.description: Spectral warriors are the ghostly remains of soldiers who died in battle with unfinished duties or unresolved conflicts. They appear as translucent figures in ancient armor, wielding ethereal weapons that can strike both corporeal and incorporeal foes. These restless spirits are bound to locations of great significance to their past lives.
monsters.traits: Incorporeal Movement: Can move through objects and creatures as difficult terrain, takes 1d10 force damage if ends turn inside object. Unfinished Business: Cannot be permanently destroyed until its earthly concerns are resolved.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two spectral weapon attacks. Spectral Longsword: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 force damage. If target is a creature, it must make a DC 12 Wisdom save or be frightened until end of next turn. Spectral Shield Bash: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 force damage and target must make DC 12 Strength save or be knocked prone. Manifest Armor: Becomes semi-corporeal for 1 minute, AC increases to 18 but loses incorporeal movement (1/day). Battle Cry: All allies within 30 feet gain advantage on next attack roll.

monsters.name: Chimera Wyrmling
monsters.description: Chimera wyrmlings are the juvenile form of the legendary chimera, possessing the heads of a lion, goat, and dragon on a powerful leonine body with dragon wings. Though smaller than their adult counterparts, they retain the three-headed nature and multiple breath weapons that make chimeras so feared. Each head has its own personality and desires.
monsters.traits: Multiple Heads: Has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and saves against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious. Wakeful: While sleeping, at least one head remains awake.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes three attacks: one bite from each head. Can substitute dragon head bite with fire breath if available. Lion Bite: +7 to hit, 1d8+4 piercing. Goat Bite: +7 to hit, 1d6+4 piercing. Dragon Bite: +7 to hit, 1d8+4 piercing plus 1d6 fire damage. Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6): Dragon head exhales fire in 15-foot cone. Each creature in area must make a DC 15 Dexterity save or take 4d6 fire damage, half on success. Pounce: If moves at least 20 feet toward target and hits with lion bite, target must make DC 15 Strength save or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Pixie
monsters.description: Pixies are tiny, winged fey creatures with gossamer wings and mischievous personalities. They stand only a foot tall and glow with a soft, multicolored light. These playful beings love pranks and riddles, but can be helpful allies to those who respect nature and show proper courtesy to the fey realm.
monsters.traits: Fairy Lights: Can dim or brighten its natural glow at will, providing bright light in 5-foot radius or no light. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Innate Spellcasting: Can cast confusion, dancing lights, detect thoughts, dispel magic, entangle, fly, phantasmal force, polymorph, and sleep once per day each without material components.
monsters.actions: Superior Invisibility: Magically turns invisible until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment it wears or carries is invisible with it. Pixie Dust: Throws sparkling dust at a creature within 30 feet. Target must make a DC 12 Constitution save or fall asleep for 1 minute. Memory Dust: Erases up to 8 hours of a sleeping creature's memory (willing targets only).

monsters.name: Quaggoth
monsters.description: Quaggoths are savage, bear-like humanoids that dwell in the deepest caves and underground passages. They have thick, shaggy fur and powerful claws adapted for climbing rocky surfaces. These primitive creatures are often enslaved by more intelligent Underdark dwellers but retain a fierce independence and hatred for their captors.
monsters.traits: Wounded Fury: While below half hit points, has advantage on attack rolls. Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two claw attacks. Claw: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 slashing. If both attacks hit the same target, the target must make a DC 13 Constitution save or be stunned until the end of its next turn. Frenzy Charge: If moves at least 20 feet toward a target and hits with both claws, deals an extra 1d6 damage with each attack.

monsters.name: Blink Dog
monsters.languages: Blink Dog, understands Sylvan but can't speak it
monsters.description: Blink dogs are intelligent, loyal canines with the magical ability to teleport short distances. They appear as medium-sized dogs with sleek coats that shimmer with an otherworldly sheen. These noble creatures often serve as companions to good-aligned fey and rangers, using their teleportation to outmaneuver enemies.
monsters.traits: Keen Hearing and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell. Pack Tactics: Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one ally is within 5 feet of the creature.
monsters.actions: Bite: +3 to hit, 1d6+1 piercing. Teleport (Recharge 4-6): Magically teleports up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see, along with any equipment it's wearing or carrying. Pack Teleport: Can teleport with up to 3 willing allies within 5 feet to the same destination (1/day).

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Pureblood
monsters.description: Yuan-ti purebloods are the most human-like of their serpentine race, able to pass for human in most circumstances. They retain only subtle serpentine features like slitted pupils or patches of scales. These cunning infiltrators serve as spies and agents for yuan-ti society, manipulating human organizations from within.
monsters.traits: Shapechanger: Can use action to polymorph into Medium snake or back to humanoid form. Equipment doesn't transform. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Innate Spellcasting: Can cast animal friendship (snakes only), poison spray, and suggestion once per day each.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two melee attacks, but can use Constrict only once. Scimitar: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Shortbow: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., 1d6+2 piercing plus poison (DC 11 Constitution save or poisoned for 1 hour). Constrict (Snake Form Only): +3 to hit, 1d4+1 bludgeoning and target is grappled (escape DC 11). Hypnotic Pattern: Creates mesmerizing display, DC 12 Wisdom save or charmed and incapacitated for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Intellect Devourer
monsters.damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.languages: Understands Deep Speech but can't speak, telepathy 60 ft.
monsters.description: Intellect devourers are horrifying aberrations that resemble walking brains with four clawed legs. These parasitic creatures seek to consume the minds of intelligent beings, leaving empty husks that they can then inhabit and control. They are often found serving mind flayers or other aberrant masters.
monsters.traits: Detect Sentience: Can sense the presence and location of any creature within 300 feet that has Intelligence 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes one devour intellect attack and uses Body Thief if available. Claws: +4 to hit, 2d6+2 slashing. Devour Intellect: Target creature within 10 feet must make a DC 12 Intelligence save or take 2d10 psychic damage and have Intelligence reduced by 1d4. If Intelligence drops to 0, creature dies and intellect devourer can use Body Thief. Body Thief: Enters the corpse of a humanoid whose Intelligence was reduced to 0. While inside, has total cover and controls the body but retains its mental ability scores.

monsters.name: Displacer Beast Cub
monsters.description: Displacer beast cubs are the young offspring of the feared displacer beasts, already showing signs of their parents' reality-bending abilities. They appear as large felines with two writhing tentacles sprouting from their shoulders. Even as juveniles, they can create minor displacement illusions that make them difficult to target accurately.
monsters.traits: Displacement: Creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against the displacer beast cub unless the cub is incapacitated or restrained. Avoidance: If subjected to an effect that allows a Dexterity save for half damage, takes no damage on success and half damage on failure.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one tentacle. Bite: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing. Tentacle: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d6+3 bludgeoning. If both attacks hit the same target, target must make a DC 13 Strength save or be knocked prone. Phase Step: Teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Awakened Tree
monsters.languages: One language known by its creator
monsters.description: Awakened trees are ordinary trees granted consciousness and mobility through powerful druidic magic. They retain their natural appearance but can move their roots and branches at will. These gentle giants are wise guardians of the forest, speaking in deep, rustling voices like wind through leaves.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from a normal tree. Speak with Plants: Can communicate with other plants as if they shared a language.
monsters.actions: Slam: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., 3d6+4 bludgeoning. Root Entangle: Roots burst from ground in 20-foot radius. Each creature in area must make a DC 13 Strength save or be restrained for 1 minute. Creatures can use action to make DC 13 Strength check to free themselves or another. Branch Shield: Uses reaction to grant +2 AC to adjacent ally against one attack.

monsters.name: Harpy
monsters.description: Harpies are cruel creatures with the torso and head of a human woman and the wings and talons of a vulture. They dwell in high cliffs and rocky outcrops, using their enchanting songs to lure travelers to their doom. These vicious predators delight in tormenting their victims before devouring them.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one claws and one club. Claws: +3 to hit, 2d4+1 slashing. Club: +3 to hit, 1d4+1 bludgeoning. Luring Song: Sings a magical melody. Each humanoid within 300 feet that can hear must make a DC 11 Wisdom save or be charmed until song ends. While charmed, target is incapacitated and must move toward harpy by most direct route. Can repeat save if harpy or its allies damage the target. Diving Attack: If flies at least 20 feet toward target and hits with claws, deals extra 1d4 damage.

monsters.name: Bulezau
monsters.description: Bulezau are demons that resemble hairless, emaciated minotaurs with rotting flesh and exposed bone. They serve as shock troops in demonic armies, reveling in destruction and pain. Their bodies constantly rot and regenerate, creating a nauseating stench that can sicken nearby creatures.
monsters.traits: Rotting Presence: Each creature that starts its turn within 5 feet must make a DC 14 Constitution save or be poisoned until start of next turn. Standing Leap: Long jump up to 20 feet and high jump up to 10 feet without a running start.
monsters.actions: Barbed Tail: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d6+2 piercing plus 1d6 poison damage. Fists: +4 to hit, 2d4+2 bludgeoning. If both fists hit same target, target must make DC 14 Constitution save or be stunned until end of next turn. Charge: If moves at least 10 feet toward target and hits with fists, target must make DC 14 Strength save or be knocked prone. Death Throes: When reduced to 0 hp, explodes. Each creature within 10 feet takes 1d6 fire damage, DC 14 Dexterity save for half.

monsters.name: Medusa Spawn
monsters.description: Medusa spawn are the lesser offspring of the legendary medusa, possessing serpentine hair and a weakened but still dangerous petrifying gaze. They appear as beautiful humanoids until their hair begins to writhe and their eyes begin to glow with malevolent power. These cursed beings often serve their medusa parent or seek to build their own domain of stone victims.
monsters.traits: Petrifying Gaze: When creature that can see medusa spawn's eyes starts turn within 30 feet, medusa spawn can force it to make DC 14 Constitution save if spawn isn't incapacitated. Failure means creature begins turning to stone and is restrained. Must repeat save at end of next turn; success ends effect, failure results in petrification until freed by greater restoration or similar magic.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes either three melee attacks (one snake hair and two shortsword) or two ranged attacks. Snake Hair: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d4+2 piercing plus 2d6 poison damage. Shortsword: +5 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing. Longbow: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., 1d8+2 piercing. Stone Curse: Target within 60 feet must make DC 14 Constitution save or have speed reduced by 10 feet for 1 minute as flesh begins to harden (1/day).

monsters.name: Awakened Bush
monsters.languages: One language known by its creator
monsters.description: Awakened bushes are small shrubs given consciousness through druidic magic. They appear as ordinary bushes until they begin to rustle and move of their own accord. These curious plant creatures are eager to explore the world beyond their roots and often serve as scouts or messengers for forest guardians.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from a normal bush. Plant Speech: Can communicate with other plants within 30 feet.
monsters.actions: Rake: +1 to hit, 1d4-1 slashing. Tangle: Target within 5 feet must make a DC 9 Dexterity save or have speed reduced by 10 feet until end of next turn as thorny branches wrap around legs. Berry Toss: Throws nutritious berries to heal an ally within 15 feet for 1d4 hit points (3/day).

monsters.name: Cave Bear
monsters.description: Cave bears are massive ursines adapted to life in underground caverns and mountain caves. They are larger and more aggressive than their surface cousins, with thick fur and powerful claws for digging through rocky terrain. These territorial predators jealously guard their dens and food sources.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Cave Dweller: Has advantage on Constitution saves against environmental hazards in underground areas.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claw. Bite: +7 to hit, 1d8+5 piercing. Claw: +7 to hit, 2d6+5 slashing. Roar: Each creature within 30 feet must make a DC 13 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6). Bear Hug: Grapples a Large or smaller creature. While grappled, target takes 1d8+5 bludgeoning damage at start of each turn.

monsters.name: Imp Familiar
monsters.damage_resistances: Cold; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.description: Imp familiars are small devils bound to serve spellcasters through infernal contracts. They appear as tiny winged humanoids with horns, tails, and mischievous grins. While loyal to their masters, these cunning fiends always seek ways to corrupt their summoners and advance their own diabolic agendas.
monsters.traits: Shapechanger: Can use action to polymorph into rat, raven, or spider, or back to true form. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Devil's Sight: Magical darkness doesn't impair darkvision.
monsters.actions: Sting (Bite in Beast Form): +5 to hit, 1d4+3 piercing plus 3d6 poison damage. Target must make DC 11 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 day. If poison damage reduces target to 0 hp, target is stable but poisoned and unconscious for 1 hour. Invisibility: Magically turns invisible until it attacks or loses concentration. Suggestion: Target must make DC 11 Wisdom save or follow reasonable suggestion for 8 hours (1/day).

monsters.name: Gnoll Fang
monsters.description: Gnoll fangs are the elite hunters and trackers of gnoll war bands. These hyena-like humanoids have enhanced their natural predatory instincts through ritual scarification and trophy collection. They lead raids on settlements and caravans, coordinating pack attacks with savage efficiency.
monsters.traits: Pack Tactics: Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one ally is within 5 feet of the creature. Rampage: When reduces creature to 0 hit points with melee attack, can move up to half speed and make bite attack as bonus action.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one spear or battleaxe. Bite: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing. Spear: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing (or 1d8+2 if used two-handed). Battleaxe: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 slashing. Javelin: +3 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d6+2 piercing. Howl: Calls for reinforcements, 1d4 gnolls arrive in 2d6 rounds (1/day).

monsters.name: Gelatinous Cube
monsters.condition_immunities: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Exhaustion, Frightened, Prone
monsters.description: Gelatinous cubes are massive, translucent oozes that perfectly fill 10-foot dungeon corridors. These mindless scavengers slowly patrol underground passages, dissolving organic matter and debris. Adventurers often don't notice them until it's too late, as their transparent bodies make them nearly invisible.
monsters.traits: Ooze Cube: Takes up entire 10-foot square. Creatures can enter the space, but doing so subjects them to cube's engulf attack. Transparent: Has advantage on Stealth checks while motionless.
monsters.actions: Pseudopod: +4 to hit, 3d6 acid damage. Engulf: Cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, can enter Large or smaller creature's space. When cube enters creature's space, creature must make DC 12 Dexterity save. Success means creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet or be engulfed. Engulfed creatures are blinded, restrained, and take 3d6 acid damage at start of cube's turn. Acid Spray: 15-foot cone, DC 12 Dexterity save or 2d6 acid damage (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Owlbear
monsters.description: Owlbears are ferocious hybrid creatures combining the body of a bear with the head and front talons of a giant owl. These territorial predators are equally comfortable hunting day or night, using their keen senses to track prey through dense forests. Their distinctive hooting roar can be heard for miles.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one beak and one claw. Beak: +7 to hit, 1d10+5 piercing. Claw: +7 to hit, 2d8+5 slashing. Pounce: If moves at least 20 feet toward target and hits with claw attack, target must make DC 15 Strength save or be knocked prone. If target is prone, owlbear can make one beak attack as bonus action.

monsters.name: Ankheg
monsters.senses: Darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 11
monsters.description: Ankhegs are large, insectoid burrowers with chitinous shells and powerful mandibles. They tunnel beneath farmlands and forests, emerging suddenly to snatch prey with their acidic bite. These ambush predators are particularly feared by farmers, as they can devastate crops and livestock with little warning.
monsters.traits: Tunneler: Can burrow through soil and leave a 5-foot diameter tunnel. Acid Splash: When ankheg takes damage, acid sprays from its wounds. Adjacent creatures take 1d4 acid damage.
monsters.actions: Bite: +5 to hit, 2d6+3 slashing plus 1d6 acid damage. Acid Spray (Recharge 6): Spits acid in 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in line must make DC 13 Dexterity save or take 3d6 acid damage, half on success. Ankheg can't use bite attack on same turn it uses acid spray. Burrow Attack: Emerges from underground within 10 feet of target and makes bite attack with advantage (if target was surprised).

monsters.name: Doppelganger
monsters.description: Doppelgangers are shapeshifting humanoids with pale, featureless faces in their natural form. These cunning infiltrators can perfectly mimic the appearance of other humanoids, using this ability to spy, steal, and manipulate. They feed on the emotions and memories of those they impersonate.
monsters.traits: Shapechanger: Can use action to polymorph into Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back to true form. Equipment doesn't change. Ambusher: Has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that haven't taken a turn yet. Surprise Attack: If surprises a creature and hits with attack during first round, target takes extra 2d6 damage.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two melee attacks. Slam: +6 to hit, 1d6+4 bludgeoning. Read Thoughts: Target within 60 feet must make DC 11 Wisdom save or doppelganger learns surface thoughts for 1 minute. Knows if save succeeded or failed. Perfect Copy: Studies target for 1 minute to gain detailed knowledge of their mannerisms, speech patterns, and memories for perfect impersonation.

monsters.name: Basilisk
monsters.description: Basilisks are serpentine reptiles with eight legs and the terrifying ability to petrify living creatures with their gaze. These ancient predators dwell in caves and ruins, surrounded by the stone statues of their victims. Their breath can also turn organic matter to stone.
monsters.traits: Petrifying Gaze: When creature that can see basilisk's eyes starts turn within 30 feet, basilisk can force it to make DC 12 Constitution save if basilisk isn't incapacitated. Failure means creature begins turning to stone and is restrained. Must repeat save at end of next turn; success ends effect, failure means petrified until freed by greater restoration or similar magic.
monsters.actions: Bite: +5 to hit, 2d6+3 piercing plus 1d6 poison damage. Stone Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales petrifying gas in 15-foot cone. Each creature in area must make DC 12 Constitution save or be restrained as they begin turning to stone. Restrained creatures repeat save at end of next turn, ending effect on success or becoming petrified on failure.

monsters.name: Cockatrice
monsters.description: Cockatrices are bizarre hybrid creatures with the head and wings of a rooster and the tail of a dragon or serpent. Despite their comical appearance, these creatures possess a deadly petrifying bite. They are territorial and aggressive, often found nesting in rocky outcrops or abandoned ruins.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing plus target must make DC 11 Constitution save or be restrained as they begin turning to stone. Restrained creature must repeat save at end of next turn; success ends effect, failure means petrified for 24 hours. Wing Buffet: Each creature within 5 feet must make DC 12 Dexterity save or be knocked prone. Territorial Screech: Hostile creatures within 30 feet must make DC 11 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Twig Blight
monsters.description: Twig blights are malevolent plant creatures that resemble small, animated bundles of sticks and branches. Created by dark druids or evil fey, these creatures serve as spies and foot soldiers in corrupted woodlands. They move with jerky, unnatural motions and attack in coordinated swarms.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from a dead shrub. Plant Camouflage: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in areas with ample vegetation.
monsters.actions: Claws: +3 to hit, 1d4+1 slashing. Animate Dead Wood: Can cause nearby dead branches to writhe and grasp at creatures within 10 feet. Targets must make DC 10 Dexterity save or be restrained until start of next turn (recharge 6). Swarm Tactics: When 3+ twig blights attack same target, each deals +1 damage.

monsters.name: Hippogriff
monsters.description: Hippogriffs are majestic creatures with the front half of an eagle and the rear half of a horse. These proud beasts soar through mountain skies and can be trained as flying mounts by those patient enough to earn their respect. They are territorial but not inherently aggressive unless threatened or protecting their young.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. Dive Attack: If flying and moves at least 20 feet toward target before hitting with claws, deals extra 1d6 damage.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one beak and one claws. Beak: +5 to hit, 1d10+3 piercing. Claws: +5 to hit, 2d6+3 slashing. Aerial Maneuver: While flying, can use reaction to impose disadvantage on one ranged attack against it.

monsters.name: Winged Kobold
monsters.description: Winged kobolds are rare variants of their earthbound cousins, possessing leathery wings that allow them to fly. These draconic humanoids serve as scouts and messengers for kobold tribes, using their aerial advantage to harass enemies and coordinate ambushes from above.
monsters.traits: Pack Tactics: Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one ally is within 5 feet of the creature. Sunlight Sensitivity: While in sunlight, has disadvantage on attack rolls and Perception checks that rely on sight. Flyby: Doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when flying out of enemy's reach.
monsters.actions: Dagger: +4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing. Sling: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d4+2 bludgeoning. Dropped Rock: While flying, drops rock on target below. +4 to hit, 1d6+2 bludgeoning. Dive Bomb: Flies down at target and makes dagger attack with advantage, then continues flying (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Hobgoblin Captain
monsters.description: Hobgoblin captains are experienced military leaders who command hobgoblin legions with tactical precision. They wear elaborate armor decorated with trophies from fallen enemies and carry weapons of superior craftsmanship. These disciplined warriors inspire fear and loyalty in equal measure.
monsters.traits: Martial Advantage: Once per turn, deals extra 2d6 damage to creature it hits if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally that isn't incapacitated. Leadership: Allies within 30 feet can add captain's Charisma modifier to damage rolls.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two greatsword attacks. Greatsword: +4 to hit, 2d6+2 slashing. Javelin: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d6+2 piercing. Command Strike: One ally within 30 feet can use reaction to make one weapon attack. Rally Troops: All hobgoblin allies within 60 feet gain advantage on next attack roll and immunity to being frightened for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Ettercap
monsters.description: Ettercaps are humanoid spiders that serve as shepherds to giant spider colonies. These aberrant creatures have pale, chitinous skin and multiple eyes scattered across their faces. They weave complex web networks through forests and caves, using them to trap prey and communicate with their spider allies.
monsters.traits: Spider Climb: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without ability checks. Web Sense: While in contact with a web, knows exact location of any creature in contact with same web. Web Walker: Ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claws, or two web attacks. Bite: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 piercing plus 1d8 poison damage. Target must make DC 11 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 minute. Claws: +4 to hit, 2d4+2 slashing. Web: +4 to hit, range 30/60 ft., target restrained by webbing. DC 12 Strength check to escape, AC 10, 5 HP, vulnerable to fire. Web Trap: Can spend 10 minutes creating 10x10 foot web trap that triggers when creature enters (DC 15 Perception to spot).

monsters.name: Griffon
monsters.description: Griffons are powerful creatures with the body of a lion and the head and wings of an eagle. These proud hunters soar through mountain peaks and coastal cliffs, building their aeries in the highest, most inaccessible places. They are fiercely territorial and protective of their young.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. Dive Attack: If flying and moves at least 20 feet straight toward target before hitting with claws, deals extra 1d6 damage.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one beak and one claws. Beak: +6 to hit, 1d8+4 piercing. Claws: +6 to hit, 2d6+4 slashing. Swooping Attack: Flies up to speed in straight line, can make one beak attack against each creature it passes within 5 feet of. Protective Screech: When defending nest or young, all creatures within 60 feet must make DC 13 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Minotaur
monsters.description: Minotaurs are hulking humanoids with the heads of bulls, known for their incredible strength and perfect sense of direction. These creatures are often found guarding ancient labyrinths and underground complexes. Despite their bestial appearance, they possess cunning intelligence and an implacable sense of purpose.
monsters.traits: Charge: If moves at least 10 feet toward target and hits with gore attack, deals extra 2d8 piercing damage. If target is creature, it must make DC 14 Strength save or be pushed 10 feet and knocked prone. Labyrinthine Recall: Can perfectly recall any path it has traveled. Relentless: When reduced to 0 hit points but not killed, drops to 1 hit point instead (recharges on long rest).
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one gore and one greataxe, or two greataxe attacks. Gore: +6 to hit, 1d8+4 piercing. Greataxe: +6 to hit, 1d12+4 slashing. Intimidating Bellow: Each creature within 30 feet must make DC 13 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6). Maze Runner: Can move through difficult terrain without penalty and ignores opportunity attacks when charging.

monsters.name: Pegasus
monsters.languages: Understands Celestial, Common, Elvish, Sylvan but can't speak
monsters.description: Pegasi are magnificent winged horses with pure white coats and feathered wings that shimmer with celestial light. These noble creatures serve as mounts for virtuous heroes and celestial beings. They can sense the moral character of those they encounter and will only allow the pure of heart to ride them.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Magic Weapons: Weapon attacks are magical. Detect Evil and Good: Can sense presence of celestials, fiends, and undead within 60 feet.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one hooves and one bite if target is prone. Hooves: +6 to hit, 2d6+4 bludgeoning. If target is prone, deals extra 1d6 damage. Healing Touch: Touches creature to restore 2d8+2 hit points (3/day). Only works on good-aligned creatures. Celestial Blessing: Grants one creature within 30 feet advantage on next saving throw and resistance to necrotic damage for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Wight
monsters.damage_resistances: Necrotic; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.languages: Common plus languages it knew in life
monsters.description: Wights are undead creatures born from souls consumed by shadow and negative energy. They retain their humanoid form but their flesh has withered and their eyes burn with malevolent hatred. These intelligent undead seek to drain life from the living and create more of their kind.
monsters.traits: Sunlight Sensitivity: While in sunlight, has disadvantage on attack rolls and Perception checks that rely on sight. Undead Nature: Doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. Longsword: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 slashing plus 1d6 necrotic damage. Longbow: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., 1d8+2 piercing plus 1d6 necrotic damage. Life Drain: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 necrotic damage and target must make DC 13 Constitution save or maximum hit points reduced by damage taken. Target dies if max HP reduced to 0. Humanoid killed this way rises as wight in 24 hours under this wight's control. Create Spawn: Humanoid killed by wight's Life Drain rises as wight under original wight's control after 24 hours.

monsters.name: Nothic
monsters.description: Nothics are the twisted remains of wizards who delved too deeply into forbidden knowledge. These hunched aberrations have pale, mottled skin and a single, enormous eye that can see through illusions and pierce the veil of reality. They hoard secrets and arcane knowledge in their underground lairs.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. Weird Insight: Can sense magical auras and detect lies. Knows when creature within 30 feet tells a lie.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Uses Rotting Gaze and makes one claw attack, or makes two claw attacks. Claw: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Rotting Gaze: Targets creature within 30 feet. Target must make DC 12 Constitution save or take 3d6 necrotic damage. Insight Drain: Target within 30 feet must make DC 12 Wisdom save or take 2d8 psychic damage and nothic learns one secret about the target (1/day). Secret Knowledge: Can answer questions about local history, magic, or hidden things, but demands payment in secrets or magic items.

monsters.name: Flumph
monsters.languages: Understands Undercommon but can't speak, telepathy 60 ft.
monsters.description: Flumphs are benevolent, jellyfish-like aberrations that float through underground caverns. These gentle creatures feed on psychic energy, particularly the thoughts and emotions of evil beings. They serve as information brokers and allies to good-hearted adventurers, warning them of dangers lurking in the depths.
monsters.traits: Advanced Telepathy: Can communicate telepathically with any creature that has a language within 60 feet. Prone Deficiency: Has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saves while prone. Telepathic Shriek: When takes damage, emits psychic shriek. Each creature within 20 feet that can hear telepathically takes 1d4 psychic damage.
monsters.actions: Tendrils: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d4+2 piercing plus 1d4 acid damage. Stench Spray: Sprays foul liquid in 15-foot line. Each creature in line must make DC 10 Dexterity save or be coated in stench for 1d4 hours, imposing disadvantage on Charisma checks. Knowledge Share: Can share visions or information about recent events in area (within 1 mile, last 24 hours).

monsters.name: Satyr
monsters.description: Satyrs are hedonistic fey creatures with the legs and horns of goats and the torsos of humans. These merry beings spend their time dancing, drinking, and making music in woodland clearings. While generally good-natured, they can become dangerous when their revelries are interrupted or their forest homes are threatened.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Fey Step: Can teleport up to 30 feet to unoccupied space as bonus action (recharge 4-6).
monsters.actions: Ram: +3 to hit, 2d4+1 bludgeoning. Shortsword: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 piercing. Shortbow: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., 1d6+3 piercing. Pipes of Haunting: Plays haunting melody on panpipes. Each humanoid within 60 feet must make DC 12 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute. Can repeat save at end of each turn. Charm Person: Target must make DC 12 Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 hour (3/day).

monsters.name: Carrion Crawler
monsters.description: Carrion crawlers are large, worm-like scavengers with multiple legs and writhing tentacles around their mouths. These repulsive creatures feed on rotting flesh and are often found in dungeons and battlefields. Their paralyzing tentacles make them dangerous predators despite their preference for carrion.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Spider Climb: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without ability checks.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one tentacles, or two tentacle attacks. Bite: +8 to hit, 2d4+2 piercing. Tentacles: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d4+2 piercing plus target must make DC 13 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned this way, target is paralyzed. Target can repeat save at end of each turn. Scavenge: Can detect corpses within 1 mile and gains advantage on Constitution saves when near decay.

monsters.name: Gnoll Pack Lord
monsters.description: Gnoll pack lords are the alpha leaders of gnoll war bands, larger and more cunning than their packmates. These hyena-like humanoids coordinate brutal raids and maintain order through savage displays of dominance. They wear trophies from their victories and inspire bloodlust in their followers.
monsters.traits: Pack Tactics: Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one ally is within 5 feet of the creature. Rampage: When reduces creature to 0 hit points with melee attack, can move up to half speed and make bite attack as bonus action. Incite Rampage: When gnoll ally within 30 feet reduces creature to 0 hit points, pack lord can use reaction to move up to half speed.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: either two melee attacks or one melee and one spear throw. Bite: +5 to hit, 1d4+3 piercing. Spear: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 piercing (or 1d8+3 if used two-handed). Spear (Thrown): +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1d6+3 piercing. Intimidating Howl: Each enemy within 30 feet must make DC 12 Wisdom save or be frightened until end of next turn (recharge 5-6). Blood Frenzy: All gnoll allies within 60 feet gain advantage on next attack roll and deal +1d4 damage if they hit (1/day).

monsters.name: Rust Monster
monsters.description: Rust monsters are bizarre creatures that resemble armadillos with long tails ending in paddle-like appendages. They feed exclusively on metal, able to corrode even magical items with their touch. These creatures are the bane of heavily armored adventurers and are often found in ancient ruins with abandoned weapons and armor.
monsters.traits: Iron Scent: Can pinpoint location of ferrous metal within 30 feet. Rust Metal: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, weapon takes permanent -1 penalty to damage rolls. If penalty drops to -5, weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition is destroyed after hitting.
monsters.actions: Bite: +3 to hit, 1d8+1 piercing. Antennae: Rust monster corrodes nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet. If object isn't being worn or carried, touch destroys 1-foot cube of it. If worn or carried, bearer makes DC 11 Dexterity save to avoid touch. Metal Sense: Can detect presence and general direction of metal objects within 60 feet, even through walls.

monsters.name: Peryton
monsters.damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.description: Perytons are malevolent creatures with the body of a stag and the wings and head of an eagle. Despite their majestic appearance, these beings are consumed with hatred for humanoids. They cast humanoid shadows regardless of their true form and hunt intelligent prey to steal their hearts and shadows.
monsters.traits: Dive Attack: If flying and moves at least 20 feet toward target before hitting with antlers, deals extra 1d8 damage. Keen Sight and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell. Shadow Theft: When kills humanoid, gains that creature's shadow permanently.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes one antlers attack and one talon attack. Antlers: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing. Talons: +5 to hit, 2d4+3 slashing. Heart Seeker: If both attacks hit same humanoid target, target must make DC 13 Constitution save or take extra 1d8 piercing damage as peryton attempts to tear out their heart. Shadow Mimicry: Can perfectly mimic any humanoid shadow it has stolen, potentially confusing observers about its true nature.

monsters.name: Bulette
monsters.senses: Darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 16
monsters.description: Bulettes, also known as landsharks, are massive burrowing predators with armored hides and razor-sharp teeth. These creatures can sense vibrations through the ground and burst from the earth to attack unsuspecting prey. Their incredible jumping ability allows them to leap great distances to catch flying enemies.
monsters.traits: Standing Leap: Long jump up to 30 feet and high jump up to 15 feet, with or without running start. Tunneler: Can burrow through solid rock at half speed and leaves 10-foot diameter tunnel.
monsters.actions: Bite: +7 to hit, 4d12+4 piercing. Deadly Leap: If jumps at least 15 feet as part of movement, can make bite attack with advantage. If attack hits, target must make DC 15 Strength save or be knocked prone. Burrow Attack: Emerges from underground within 10 feet of target and makes bite attack with advantage (if target surprised). Earth Tremor: Strikes ground, creating tremor in 20-foot radius. Creatures in area make DC 15 Dexterity save or fall prone (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Dryad
monsters.description: Dryads are beautiful tree spirits bound to specific oak trees in ancient forests. They appear as graceful women with bark-like skin and hair resembling leaves or moss. These gentle fey are guardians of nature who can be fierce protectors when their forest homes are threatened.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Speak with Beasts and Plants: Can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language. Tree Stride: Once per turn, can use 10 feet of movement to step into living tree within reach and emerge from second tree within 60 feet.
monsters.actions: Club: +2 to hit, 1d4 bludgeoning. Fey Charm: Target humanoid within 30 feet must make DC 14 Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 day. While charmed, target idolizes dryad and tries to help her. Target can repeat save every 24 hours. Barkskin: AC becomes 16 for 1 hour (1/day). Entangle: Grasping weeds and vines sprout in 20-foot square within 60 feet. Each creature in area makes DC 14 Strength save or be restrained for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Umber Hulk
monsters.senses: Darkvision 120 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10
monsters.description: Umber hulks are massive, beetle-like creatures with powerful claws and confusing compound eyes. These subterranean predators can tunnel through solid rock and disorient prey with their hypnotic gaze. They are often found in the deepest parts of the Underdark, where they create complex tunnel networks.
monsters.traits: Confusing Gaze: When creature starts turn within 30 feet and can see umber hulk's eyes, umber hulk can force it to make DC 15 Charisma save. Failure means creature can't take reactions until start of next turn and rolls d8 to determine action: 1-4 do nothing, 5-6 take no action but can move, 7-8 make one melee attack against random creature within reach. Tunneler: Can burrow through solid rock at half speed and leaves 5-foot wide, 8-foot high tunnel.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes three attacks: two claws and one mandibles. Claw: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d8+5 slashing. Mandibles: +8 to hit, 2d8+5 slashing. Burrow Charge: Burrows up to burrow speed and emerges within 5 feet of target, then makes claw attack with advantage. Tunnel Collapse: Causes 10-foot section of tunnel to collapse. Creatures in area make DC 15 Dexterity save or take 2d6 bludgeoning and be buried (restrained, can't breathe). DC 15 Strength check to dig out.

monsters.name: Gorgon
monsters.description: Gorgons are massive bull-like creatures with metallic scales and the ability to petrify with their breath. Despite their name, these beasts are not related to the serpent-haired medusa. They are aggressive territorial creatures that charge at intruders and turn them to stone with clouds of petrifying gas.
monsters.traits: Trampling Charge: If moves at least 20 feet toward creature and hits with gore, target must make DC 16 Strength save or be knocked prone. If target is prone, gorgon can make one hooves attack as bonus action.
monsters.actions: Gore: +8 to hit, 2d12+5 piercing. Hooves: +8 to hit, 2d10+5 bludgeoning. Petrifying Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales petrifying gas in 30-foot cone. Each creature in area must make DC 13 Constitution save. Failure means creature begins turning to stone and is restrained. Restrained creature repeats save at end of next turn; success ends effect, failure means petrified until freed by greater restoration or similar magic. Metallic Hide: When hit by melee attack, attacker takes 1d4 slashing damage from sharp scales.

monsters.name: Sprite
monsters.description: Sprites are tiny fey creatures with gossamer wings and mischievous personalities. These diminutive guardians of the forest are invisible to most creatures unless they choose to reveal themselves. They often serve as scouts and messengers for more powerful fey beings and are fiercely protective of their woodland homes.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Heart Sight: Touches creature and magically knows its current emotional state. If target fails DC 10 Charisma save, sprite also knows alignment.
monsters.actions: Longsword: +2 to hit, 1 slashing. Shortbow: +6 to hit, range 40/160 ft., 1 piercing plus poison (DC 10 Constitution save or poisoned for 1 minute). Invisibility: Magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or its concentration ends. Equipment also becomes invisible. Detect Thoughts: Can sense surface thoughts of creatures within 60 feet for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Dire Wolf
monsters.description: Dire wolves are larger, more ferocious cousins of common wolves. These apex predators hunt in coordinated packs across wilderness areas, using their superior size and intelligence to bring down prey much larger than themselves. Their howls can be heard for miles and strike fear into the hearts of travelers.
monsters.traits: Keen Hearing and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell. Pack Tactics: Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one ally is within 5 feet of the creature.
monsters.actions: Bite: +5 to hit, 2d6+3 piercing. If target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. Pack Howl: Calls other wolves within 1 mile. 1d4 wolves arrive in 1d6 rounds if any are in area (1/day). Alpha Challenge: Forces one creature within 30 feet to make DC 13 Wisdom save or be frightened and must use reaction to move away from dire wolf.

monsters.name: Orc Berserker
monsters.description: Orc berserkers are savage warriors who enter battle-rage when fighting, becoming nearly unstoppable forces of destruction. They paint their bodies with war paint and ritual scars, and their eyes burn with bloodlust. These fearsome fighters often lead orc raids and inspire terror in their enemies.
monsters.traits: Aggressive: As bonus action, can move up to speed toward hostile creature it can see. Relentless Endurance: When reduced to 0 hit points but not killed, can drop to 1 hit point instead (recharges on long rest).
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two greataxe attacks while raging. Greataxe: +5 to hit, 1d12+3 slashing. Javelin: +3 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d6+3 piercing. Berserker Rage: Enters rage for 1 minute (1/day). While raging, has advantage on Strength checks and saves, +2 damage on Strength-based melee attacks, and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Battle Cry: All orc allies within 30 feet gain advantage on next attack roll.

monsters.name: Spectator
monsters.description: Spectators are lesser cousins of the dreaded beholder, summoned to guard specific locations or objects. These floating aberrations have four eyestalks instead of ten and lack the antimagic central eye. They are bound by magical contracts and take their guardian duties very seriously.
monsters.traits: Flight: Hovers in place and can't be knocked prone. Spell Reflection: If targeted by spell that targets only the spectator and isn't area effect, spectator can use reaction to reflect spell back at caster.
monsters.actions: Bite: +1 to hit, 2d6+1 piercing. Eye Rays: Shoots two random eye rays at targets within 90 feet. Roll d4 for each ray: 1. Confusion Ray - DC 13 Wisdom save or use action to make melee attack against random creature within reach. 2. Paralyzing Ray - DC 13 Constitution save or paralyzed for 1 minute. 3. Fear Ray - DC 13 Wisdom save or frightened for 1 minute. 4. Wounding Ray - DC 13 Constitution save or take 3d10 necrotic damage. Create Food and Water: Creates enough food and water for 6 people for 24 hours (1/day).

monsters.name: Owlbear
monsters.description: Owlbears are ferocious predators that combine the worst aspects of both owls and bears. These massive creatures have keen senses, powerful claws, and razor-sharp beaks. They are territorial and aggressive, attacking anything that enters their domain with savage fury.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one beak and one claw. Beak: +7 to hit, 1d10+5 piercing. Claw: +7 to hit, 2d8+5 slashing. Pounce: If moves at least 20 feet toward target and hits with claw attack, target must make DC 15 Strength save or be knocked prone. If target is prone, owlbear can make one beak attack as bonus action. Terrifying Roar: Each creature within 30 feet must make DC 13 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Bugbear Chief
monsters.description: Bugbear chiefs are the cunning leaders of bugbear tribes, using their size and intelligence to coordinate ambushes and raids. These hairy goblinoids are expert at moving silently despite their bulk and prefer to strike from shadows. They rule through intimidation and strategic brutality.
monsters.traits: Brute: Melee weapon deals one extra die of damage (included in attacks). Surprise Attack: If surprises creature and hits with attack during first round of combat, target takes extra 2d6 damage. Sneaky: Despite size, can attempt to hide when only lightly obscured.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two melee attacks. Morningstar: +5 to hit, 2d8+3 piercing. Javelin: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d6+3 piercing. Heart of Hruggek: Can enter frenzy for 1 minute, gaining extra attack each turn but attack rolls against it have advantage (1/day).
