Command Ambush: Up to 3 allied bugbears can use reaction to move up to their speed and make one attack.

monsters.name: Displacer Beast
monsters.description: Displacer beasts are large feline predators with two writhing tentacles that end in horny ridges. These creatures appear to be several feet away from their actual location, making them extremely difficult to target accurately. They are cunning hunters that use their displacement ability to confuse and terrorize prey.
monsters.traits: Displacement: Unless incapacitated, creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against the displacer beast due to a magical illusion. If displacer beast takes damage, trait doesn't function until start of its next turn. Avoidance: If subjected to effect that allows Dexterity save for half damage, takes no damage on success and half on failure.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one tentacle, or two tentacle attacks. Bite: +6 to hit, 1d10+4 piercing. Tentacle: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d6+4 bludgeoning plus 1d6 piercing. If both tentacle attacks hit same creature, target is grappled (escape DC 14). Phase Shift: Teleports up to 60 feet to unoccupied space it can see, along with any equipment (recharge 4-6).

monsters.name: Banshee
monsters.damage_resistances: Acid, Fire, Lightning, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained
monsters.description: Banshees are the undead spirits of female elves who were betrayed by loved ones or died in anguish. These mournful undead are bound to locations of great personal significance and wail with supernatural sorrow. Their cries can kill mortals with sheer despair.
monsters.traits: Detect Life: Can magically sense living creatures up to 5 miles away. Incorporeal Movement: Can move through objects and creatures as difficult terrain, takes 1d10 force damage if ends turn inside object.
monsters.actions: Corrupting Touch: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 3d6+2 necrotic damage. Horrifying Visage: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet that can see banshee must make DC 13 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute. Frightened target can repeat save at end of each turn. Wail (1/Day): Emits magical wail. Each creature within 30 feet that can hear and has fewer than 100 hit points must make DC 13 Constitution save or drop to 0 hit points. Those with 100+ hit points take 3d6 psychic damage.

monsters.name: Cloaker
monsters.description: Cloakers are aberrant predators that resemble flying manta rays made of shadow and darkness. They can perfectly mimic the appearance of a black cloak when motionless and often hang from cave ceilings waiting for prey to pass beneath. Their haunting moans can drive creatures mad with fear.
monsters.traits: Damage Transfer: While attached to creature, cloaker takes only half damage from attacks, and attached creature takes the other half. False Appearance: While motionless without light, is indistinguishable from dark leather cloak. Light Sensitivity: While in bright light, has disadvantage on attack rolls and Perception checks.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one tail, or uses Moan and makes one bite attack. Bite: +6 to hit, 2d6+3 piercing plus 1d6 acid damage. Tail: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d8+3 slashing. Moan: Each creature within 60 feet that can hear must make DC 13 Wisdom save. Failure results in different effect based on roll: 1-4 frightened until end of next turn, 5-8 frightened and speed reduced to 0 for 1 minute, 9+ unconscious for 1 minute. Phantasms (Recharge 6): Creates 3 illusory duplicates that last 1 minute. Each appears within 30 feet and has AC 10, 1 hp, and mimics cloaker's movements.

monsters.name: Young Remorhaz
monsters.senses: Darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10
monsters.description: Young remorhazes are juvenile versions of the massive arctic worms, but still formidable predators in their own right. These creatures have segmented bodies that glow with internal heat and can burrow through ice and frozen ground. Their heated bodies make them dangerous to grapple.
monsters.traits: Heated Body: Creature that touches remorhaz or hits it with melee attack while within 5 feet takes 1d6 fire damage. Tunneler: Can burrow through ice and permafrost, leaving 5-foot diameter tunnel.
monsters.actions: Bite: +7 to hit, 3d10+4 piercing plus 1d6 fire damage. If target is creature, it must make DC 15 Dexterity save or be swallowed. Swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover, and takes 2d6 acid and 2d6 fire damage at start of each remorhaz turn. If remorhaz takes 25+ damage in single turn from swallowed creature, must succeed DC 16 Constitution save or regurgitate all swallowed creatures. Tremor Sense: Can detect and pinpoint origin of vibrations within 60 feet, including creatures moving on surface above.

monsters.name: Flying Snake
monsters.description: Flying snakes are colorful serpents with feathered wings that allow them to glide through jungle canopies. These small but venomous creatures are often found coiled around branches high above the forest floor. They hunt small birds and mammals, using their flight to escape larger predators.
monsters.traits: Flyby: Doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach. Jungle Camouflage: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in jungle terrain.
monsters.actions: Bite: +6 to hit, 1 piercing plus 1d4 poison damage. Target must make DC 10 Constitution save or take 1d4 poison damage and be poisoned for 1 hour. Gliding Strike: While flying, can make bite attack with advantage if it moves at least 20 feet toward target. Canopy Escape: Can quickly disappear into thick foliage, becoming effectively invisible until start of next turn (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Jungle Spider
monsters.description: Jungle spiders are large arachnids with vibrant markings that hunt from elaborate webs strung between trees. These patient predators inject paralytic venom that keeps prey alive but helpless for days. Their colorful patterns serve as both camouflage among tropical flowers and warning to potential threats.
monsters.traits: Spider Climb: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without ability checks. Web Sense: While in contact with web, knows exact location of creatures touching same web. Tropical Camouflage: Has advantage on Stealth checks while motionless in jungle vegetation.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing plus 1d6 poison damage. Target must make DC 11 Constitution save or be paralyzed for 1 minute. Can repeat save at end of each turn. Web Trap: Can create 5x5 foot web between trees that restrains creatures (DC 12 Strength to break free, AC 10, 5 HP). Venom Spray: Sprays poison in 10-foot cone, DC 11 Constitution save or poisoned for 1 minute (recharge 6).

monsters.name: Tribal Warrior
monsters.description: Tribal warriors are indigenous people who have lived in harmony with the jungle for generations. They wear minimal clothing decorated with feathers and bone ornaments, and their skin is often painted with natural dyes. These skilled hunters know every path and hidden danger in their territory.
monsters.traits: Jungle Born: Has advantage on Survival checks in jungle terrain and is immune to diseases common to tropical regions. Pack Tactics: Has advantage on attack rolls if at least one ally is within 5 feet of target.
monsters.actions: Spear: +3 to hit, 1d6+1 piercing (or 1d8+1 if used two-handed). Blowgun: +1 to hit, range 25/100 ft., 1 piercing plus DC 10 Constitution save or poisoned for 1 minute. Javelin: +3 to hit, range 30/120 ft., 1d6+1 piercing. Net: +1 to hit, range 5/15 ft., target restrained (DC 10 to escape). Jungle Knowledge: Can navigate jungle without error and identify edible plants, dangerous creatures, and weather patterns.

monsters.name: Constrictor Snake
monsters.description: Constrictor snakes are massive serpents that kill prey by wrapping around them and crushing the life from their bodies. These powerful reptiles can grow to over 20 feet in length and are equally at home in water or draped across jungle branches. They are patient ambush predators.
monsters.traits: Hold Breath: Can hold breath for 10 minutes. Ambush Predator: Has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that haven't taken a turn in combat yet.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing. Constrict: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d8+2 bludgeoning and target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until grapple ends, creature is restrained and takes 1d8+2 bludgeoning damage at start of each of its turns. Snake can constrict only one target at a time. Branch Drop: If positioned above target, can drop down and make constrict attack with advantage.

monsters.name: Ape
monsters.description: Apes are powerful primates that swing through jungle canopies with remarkable agility. These intelligent creatures live in family groups and can use simple tools to solve problems. When threatened, they work together to drive off intruders with coordinated attacks and intimidating displays.
monsters.traits: Brachiating: Can move through trees at full speed without penalty. Tool Use: Can use simple tools like rocks and sticks as weapons, dealing +1 damage.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two fist attacks. Fist: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 bludgeoning. Rock: +5 to hit, range 25/50 ft., 1d6+3 bludgeoning. Intimidating Display: Beats chest and howls. Each creature within 30 feet must make DC 12 Wisdom save or be frightened until end of next turn (recharge 5-6). Vine Swing: Can swing up to 40 feet between trees as part of movement, potentially avoiding opportunity attacks.

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Malison
monsters.description: Yuan-ti malisons are serpentine humanoids with more pronounced snake features than their pureblood cousins. They possess snake tails instead of legs and scaled skin across their bodies. These cunning creatures serve as enforcers and spies for yuan-ti society, using their natural abilities to infiltrate and corrupt.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Innate Spellcasting: Can cast animal friendship (snakes only), suggestion, and darkness once per day each. Serpentine: Can move through spaces as narrow as 2.5 feet without squeezing.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one scimitar, or two scimitar attacks. Bite (Snake Form): +5 to hit, 1d4+3 piercing plus 2d6 poison damage. Scimitar: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 slashing. Shortbow: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., 1d6+2 piercing plus poison coating (DC 13 Constitution save or poisoned for 1 hour). Hypnotic Pattern: Creates swirling pattern of colors in 30-foot cube. Each creature in area makes DC 13 Wisdom save or be charmed and incapacitated for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Jaguar
monsters.description: Jaguars are powerful spotted cats that reign as apex predators in jungle environments. These muscular felines are excellent swimmers and climbers, equally at home stalking prey through dense undergrowth or along riverbanks. Their incredibly strong jaws can crush the skulls of their victims.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Pounce: If moves at least 20 feet toward creature and hits with claw attack, target must make DC 13 Strength save or be knocked prone. If target is prone, jaguar can make one bite attack as bonus action.
monsters.actions: Bite: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing. If target is prone, bite deals extra 1d6 damage. Claw: +5 to hit, 2d4+3 slashing. Ambush: If jaguar has advantage on attack roll and hits, target must make DC 13 Constitution save or be stunned until end of next turn as jaguar's powerful bite crushes vital areas. River Hunt: While swimming, has advantage on Stealth checks and can hold breath for 30 minutes.

monsters.name: Vine Blight
monsters.description: Vine blights are corrupted jungle plants animated by dark magic. They appear as masses of thorny vines and creepers that can blend seamlessly with normal vegetation. These malevolent plants actively hunt living creatures, using their ability to control nearby vines to trap and strangle prey.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, is indistinguishable from normal jungle vines. Entangling Vines: Difficult terrain extends 10 feet around the blight. When creature starts turn in this area, vines grab at it and creature must make DC 12 Strength save or be restrained until start of next turn.
monsters.actions: Constrict: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., 2d6+2 bludgeoning and target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until grapple ends, target is restrained and blight can't constrict another target. Thorn Spray: Shoots thorns in 15-foot cone, DC 12 Dexterity save or 2d4 piercing damage (recharge 5-6). Animate Vines: Causes nearby vines in 20-foot radius to writhe and grasp. Area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute and creatures entering take 1d4 piercing damage.

monsters.name: Shambling Mound
monsters.description: Shambling mounds are massive plant creatures composed of rotting vegetation, vines, and moss that have gained malevolent consciousness. They lurk in the deepest parts of jungles where the canopy blocks out most sunlight, creating a perpetual twilight perfect for ambush attacks.
monsters.traits: Lightning Absorption: When subjected to lightning damage, takes no damage and regains hit points equal to lightning damage dealt. Jungle Camouflage: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in jungle terrain.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two slam attacks. If both hit Medium or smaller target, target is grappled and shambling mound uses Engulf on it. Slam: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., 2d8+4 bludgeoning. Engulf: Grappled creature is engulfed and blinded, restrained, unable to breathe, and takes 2d8+4 bludgeoning damage at start of each of mound's turns. Mound can have only one engulfed creature at a time. Overgrowth: Causes plants in 30-foot radius to grow rapidly, creating difficult terrain and providing total cover in some areas (1/day).

monsters.name: T-Rex
monsters.description: Tyrannosaurus Rex is the ultimate apex predator, a massive theropod dinosaur with bone-crushing jaws and tiny but powerful arms. These colossal hunters rule their territory through sheer size and ferocity, capable of swallowing human-sized prey whole. Their thunderous roars can be heard for miles.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Powerful Build: Counts as one size larger for carrying capacity and push/drag/lift limits.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes one bite attack. If bite hits Large or smaller creature, must make DC 17 Dexterity save or be swallowed. Swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover, and takes 3d6 acid damage at start of each T-Rex turn. If T-Rex takes 25+ damage in single turn from swallowed creature, must succeed DC 20 Constitution save or regurgitate. Bite: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., 4d12+7 piercing. Tail: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., 3d8+7 bludgeoning and target must make DC 18 Strength save or be knocked prone. Frightful Presence: Each creature within 120 feet that can see T-Rex must make DC 17 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6). Territorial Roar: Roar can be heard up to 6 miles away, potentially attracting other dinosaurs or scaring away smaller creatures.

monsters.name: Poison Dart Frog
monsters.description: Poison dart frogs are tiny amphibians with brilliantly colored skin that serves as a warning to predators. These small creatures secrete potent toxins through their skin, making them deadly to touch despite their diminutive size. Tribal peoples often use their poison to coat weapons and darts.
monsters.traits: Amphibious: Can breathe air and water. Poisonous Skin: Creature that touches frog or hits it with melee attack while within 5 feet takes 1d4 poison damage. Bright Warning: Vibrant coloration grants advantage on Intimidation checks against creatures that can see color.
monsters.actions: Tiny Bite: +4 to hit, 1 piercing plus 2d4 poison damage. Target must make DC 10 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 hour. Poison Spray: Sprays toxins in 5-foot cone, DC 10 Constitution save or take 1d6 poison damage and be poisoned for 10 minutes. Leap: Can jump up to 20 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

monsters.name: Quetzalcoatlus
monsters.description: Quetzalcoatlus are massive pterosaurs with wingspans that can exceed 30 feet. These ancient flying reptiles soar above jungle canopies searching for carrion and small prey. Despite their size, they are surprisingly graceful in flight and can spot movement from incredible distances.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. Dive Bomb: If flying and moves at least 40 feet toward target before hitting with beak, deals extra 1d8 damage and target must make DC 13 Strength save or be knocked prone.
monsters.actions: Beak: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., 2d6+2 piercing. Wing Buffet: Each creature within 10 feet must make DC 13 Dexterity save or be knocked prone and pushed 5 feet away. Scavenger's Eye: Can spot carrion or wounded creatures from up to 2 miles away while flying. Thermal Soaring: Can fly for hours without landing by riding thermal updrafts.

monsters.name: Kamadan
monsters.description: Kamadans are leopard-like creatures with serpentine necks ending in humanoid heads. These bizarre predators use their human-like appearance to lure unsuspecting victims close before revealing their true nature. They are patient hunters that can remain motionless for hours waiting for the perfect moment to strike.
monsters.traits: Pounce: If moves at least 20 feet toward creature and hits with claw attack, target must make DC 14 Strength save or be knocked prone. If target is prone, kamadan can make one bite attack as bonus action. Mimicry: Can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as humanoid voices calling for help.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes three attacks: one bite and two claws. Bite: +5 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing. Claw: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 slashing. Sleep Breath: Exhales sleep gas in 15-foot cone. Each creature in area must make DC 13 Constitution save or fall unconscious for 1 minute. Unconscious creatures awaken if they take damage or another creature uses action to wake them. Lure: Makes distressed humanoid sounds to attract prey within 300 feet (DC 15 Insight to recognize as false).

monsters.name: Su-Monster
monsters.description: Su-monsters are ape-like creatures with long prehensile tails ending in crystalline growths. These intelligent climbers inhabit jungle canopies where they use their psychic abilities to disorient prey before attacking. Their crystal tail tips can drain mental energy from victims.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Prehensile Tail: Can manipulate objects and make attacks with its tail as if it were a hand.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one claw and one tail, or two claw attacks. Claw: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing. Tail: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d4+2 bludgeoning plus 1d4 psychic damage. Psychic Drain: Target within 30 feet must make DC 12 Wisdom save or take 2d6 psychic damage and su-monster regains hit points equal to damage dealt (recharge 5-6). Canopy Leap: Can leap up to 30 feet between trees without falling.

monsters.name: Couatl
monsters.damage_immunities: Psychic; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.description: Couatls are benevolent serpentine celestials with brilliant feathered wings and wise, ancient eyes. These divine guardians protect sacred jungle sites and guide worthy mortals on righteous quests. They appear as massive feathered serpents with an aura of divine majesty.
monsters.traits: Magic Weapons: Weapon attacks are magical. Innate Spellcasting: 9th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 16. Can cast detect evil and good, detect magic, detect thoughts at will. 3/day each: bless, create food and water, cure wounds, lesser restoration, protection from poison, sanctuary, shield. 1/day each: dream, greater restoration, scrying.
monsters.actions: Bite: +8 to hit, 1d6+6 piercing plus 4d8 poison damage. Target must make DC 15 Constitution save or be poisoned for 24 hours. Until poison ends, target is unconscious. Another creature can use action to shake target awake. Constrict: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., 2d6+6 bludgeoning and target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until grapple ends, target is restrained. Change Shape: Magically polymorphs into humanoid or beast with CR 4 or lower, or back to true form. Statistics are same except size. Equipment doesn't change. Reverts if dies. Divine Protection: Can cast shield of faith on ally within 60 feet as bonus action (3/day).

monsters.name: Triceratops
monsters.description: Triceratops are massive herbivorous dinosaurs with three prominent horns and a large bony frill protecting their necks. Despite being plant-eaters, these powerful creatures are extremely territorial and will charge at any perceived threat with devastating force. Their horns can pierce through armor and bone with ease.
monsters.traits: Trampling Charge: If moves at least 20 feet toward creature and hits with gore, target must make DC 16 Strength save or be knocked prone. If target is prone, triceratops can make one stomp attack as bonus action.
monsters.actions: Gore: +9 to hit, 4d8+6 piercing. Stomp: +9 to hit, 3d10+6 bludgeoning (only against prone targets). Intimidating Display: Lowers head and shows frill while trumpeting. Each creature within 30 feet must make DC 14 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6). Herd Mentality: If another triceratops is within 60 feet, gains advantage on attack rolls and immunity to being frightened.

monsters.name: Naga
monsters.description: Nagas are ancient serpentine beings with humanoid torsos and wise, malevolent intelligence. These powerful spellcasters guard forgotten temples and treasure hoards deep in jungle ruins. Their hypnotic gaze and potent magic make them formidable opponents who prefer to toy with intruders before destroying them.
monsters.traits: Spellcasting: 10th-level spellcaster, spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks. Rejuvenation: If destroyed, returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this.
monsters.actions: Bite: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d8+4 piercing plus 4d8 poison damage. Lightning Bolt: Creates bolt of lightning in 100-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in line makes DC 14 Dexterity save, taking 6d6 lightning damage on failure or half on success (3/day). Spells: Cantrips (4): mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost. 1st level (4): charm person, detect magic. 2nd level (3): suggestion. 3rd level (3): lightning bolt. 4th level (3): blight, wall of fire. 5th level (2): dominate person. Hypnotic Pattern: Creates swirling pattern in 30-foot cube. Each creature in area makes DC 14 Wisdom save or be charmed and incapacitated for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Thought Sliver
monsters.description: Thought slivers are tiny fragments of psychic energy that have gained rudimentary consciousness in the Astral Plane. They appear as shimmering, translucent wisps that dart through the silver void, feeding on stray thoughts and emotions. These creatures are drawn to active minds like moths to flame.
monsters.traits: Incorporeal Movement: Can move through objects and creatures as if they were difficult terrain. Takes 1d4 force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. Thought Sense: Can detect thinking creatures within 120 feet, regardless of barriers.
monsters.actions: Memory Drain: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d4+3 psychic damage. Target must make DC 10 Intelligence save or forget one piece of information from the last 24 hours. Psychic Feedback: When destroyed, releases burst of psychic energy. All creatures within 10 feet take 1d4 psychic damage. Collective Swarm: When 5+ thought slivers are within 30 feet of each other, they can combine their Memory Drain attacks into a single assault.

monsters.name: Astral Drifter
monsters.languages: Common plus two others, telepathy 60 ft.
monsters.description: Astral drifters are the psychic projections of mortals whose consciousness has become lost in the Astral Plane. They retain memories of their former lives but exist as translucent, floating forms tethered to their distant physical bodies by silver cords. Many seek help returning home.
monsters.traits: Astral Form: Immune to physical needs like food, water, and sleep. Can't interact with physical objects on other planes. Silver Cord: Has invisible connection to physical body. If cord is severed (AC 20, 20 HP), drifter dies instantly.
monsters.actions: Psychic Touch: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d6+1 psychic damage plus target must make DC 12 Wisdom save or be stunned until end of next turn. Astral Sight: Can see into Border Ethereal and detect invisible creatures within 60 feet. Desperate Plea: Attempts to communicate distress telepathically to all creatures within 120 feet, potentially attracting help or unwanted attention. Memory Share: Can show another creature visions of its past life or knowledge of the Material Plane.

monsters.name: Cerebral Stalker
monsters.description: Cerebral stalkers are predatory aberrations that hunt through the Astral Plane, seeking minds to devour. They appear as floating brain-like masses with writhing tentacles and multiple eyes. These creatures can track thoughts across vast astral distances and phase between dimensions at will.
monsters.traits: Thought Tracking: Can follow the psychic trail of any creature that has used telepathy or psionics within the last 24 hours. Dimensional Phase: Can shift between Astral Plane and Border Ethereal as a bonus action.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two tentacle attacks or one tentacle and uses Mind Blast. Tentacle: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., 1d8+4 psychic damage plus target must make DC 13 Wisdom save or have Intelligence reduced by 1d4. If Intelligence drops to 0, creature becomes catatonic. Mind Blast: 60-foot cone, DC 13 Intelligence save or take 2d8 psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. Stunned creatures can repeat save at end of each turn. Psychic Drain: Regains 1d8 hit points when it reduces a creature's Intelligence or deals psychic damage.

monsters.name: Color Pool Sentry
monsters.description: Color pool sentries are elemental guardians that protect the swirling color pools that serve as gateways between planes. They appear as humanoid figures composed of shifting, iridescent energy that constantly changes hue. These beings are bound to prevent unauthorized planar travel.
monsters.traits: Color Shift: At start of each turn, changes color and gains different resistance: Red (fire), Blue (cold), Green (poison), Purple (necrotic), Yellow (lightning), Orange (acid). Portal Sense: Can detect any attempt to open planar portals within 1 mile.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two chromatic beam attacks. Chromatic Beam: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., 2d6+3 damage (type matches current color). Prismatic Spray: 60-foot cone, each creature rolls d8 for effect: 1-2 fire, 3-4 acid, 5-6 lightning, 7-8 cold. DC 14 Dexterity save or 4d6 damage of rolled type (recharge 5-6). Planar Lock: Prevents teleportation and planar travel in 60-foot radius for 10 minutes (1/day). Color Drain: Target within 30 feet loses color and takes 2d8 necrotic damage, sentry regains half as healing (recharge 6).

monsters.name: Psychic Storm
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained
monsters.description: Psychic storms are roiling masses of mental energy that sweep across the Astral Plane like weather phenomena. They appear as churning clouds of silver and violet energy crackling with thought-lightning. These manifestations can drive creatures mad with their chaotic mental emanations.
monsters.traits: Storm Form: Can move through spaces occupied by other creatures without penalty. Creatures starting their turn in same space take 1d6 psychic damage. Mental Static: All spellcasting within 60 feet requires concentration save (DC 15) or spell fails.
monsters.actions: Thought Lightning: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., 3d8+3 psychic damage plus target must make DC 15 Wisdom save or be confused for 1 minute. Mind Tempest: 30-foot radius, all creatures make DC 15 Intelligence save or take 4d6 psychic damage and have random thoughts implanted for 24 hours (recharge 5-6). Psychic Winds: Creates 60-foot radius area of difficult terrain and creatures moving through take 1d4 psychic damage per 5 feet moved. Overload: When reduced to 0 hit points, explodes. All creatures within 30 feet make DC 15 Constitution save or be stunned for 1d4 rounds.

monsters.name: Astral Leviathan
monsters.description: Astral leviathans are massive whale-like aberrations that swim through the silver void of the Astral Plane. These ancient creatures feed on psychic energy and memories, growing larger with each mind they consume. Their songs can be heard across vast astral distances.
monsters.traits: Astral Swimming: Moves through astral medium as if swimming through water. Psychic Echolocation: Can map surroundings and detect creatures through psychic pulses up to 1 mile away. Memory Hoard: Contains thousands of absorbed memories and can share knowledge from any creature it has consumed.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes one bite and uses Psychic Song. Bite: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., 3d10+5 piercing plus 2d8 psychic damage. Psychic Song: All creatures within 120 feet must make DC 16 Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 minute and compelled to move toward leviathan. Tail Slam: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., 2d12+5 bludgeoning and target must make DC 16 Strength save or be pushed 20 feet away. Memory Drain: Target within 60 feet makes DC 16 Intelligence save or loses all memories from last 24 hours and leviathan regains 2d8 hit points. Astral Breach: Creates temporary portal to random plane for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Silver Cord Weaver
monsters.description: Silver cord weavers are mysterious aberrations that manipulate the silver cords connecting astral travelers to their physical bodies. They appear as spider-like creatures made of crystalline silver threads. These beings can sever, repair, or redirect the psychic lifelines of planar travelers.
monsters.traits: Cord Sight: Can see all silver cords within 120 feet and determine their origin planes. Web Walker: Ignores movement restrictions from webs of any kind. Planar Expertise: Has extensive knowledge of planar travel and astral phenomena.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two cord lash attacks or one lash and uses Cord Manipulation. Cord Lash: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., 2d6+4 slashing plus target's silver cord (if any) takes damage. Cord Severing: Attempts to cut silver cord of astral traveler within 30 feet. Target makes DC 16 Constitution save or cord is severed and creature dies instantly. Cord Repair: Can restore severed silver cord if creature has been dead less than 1 minute (3/day). Cord Redirect: Changes destination of silver cord, potentially stranding traveler on wrong plane (DC 16 Wisdom save to resist). Web of Cords: Creates 20-foot cube of silver cord webbing that restrains creatures (DC 15 Strength to escape) and prevents planar travel.

monsters.name: Void Swimmer
monsters.description: Void swimmers are massive ray-like aberrations that glide through the empty spaces between thoughts in the Astral Plane. These creatures feed on the void itself, growing larger by consuming areas of nothingness. Their presence creates dead zones where magic and thought become muted.
monsters.traits: Void Aura: Magic is suppressed in 30-foot radius around creature. Spell attacks have disadvantage and spell save DCs are reduced by 2. Dimension Door: Can teleport up to 120 feet as bonus action. Vacuum Feeding: Regains 1d8 hit points when it negates magic or drains energy.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two slam attacks. Slam: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., 2d8+4 bludgeoning plus 1d8 cold damage. Void Drain: 30-foot cone, DC 15 Constitution save or take 3d8 necrotic damage and have maximum hit points reduced by half damage taken. Swimmer regains hit points equal to total damage dealt. Null Field: Creates 20-foot radius sphere of antimagic for 1 minute (recharge 5-6). Create Void: Permanently removes 10-foot cube of astral matter, creating empty space that inhibits travel (1/day).

monsters.name: Nightmare Harvester
monsters.damage_resistances: Cold, Necrotic; Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.description: Nightmare harvesters are fiendish entities that prey upon sleeping minds accessible through the Astral Plane. They appear as dark, ethereal figures with multiple arms ending in clawed hands. These demons collect fears and nightmares to power their infernal magic.
monsters.traits: Dream Walk: Can enter dreams of sleeping creatures on any plane and manifest in their nightmares. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Fear Sense: Can detect frightened creatures within 1 mile.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes three claw attacks or two claws and one fear drain. Claw: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., 2d6+3 slashing plus 1d6 psychic damage. Fear Drain: Target within 60 feet makes DC 16 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute and harvester regains 2d8 hit points. Nightmare Projection: Forces target to experience worst fears, DC 16 Wisdom save or take 4d8 psychic damage and be incapacitated for 1 round (recharge 5-6). Terror Aura: Each creature within 30 feet that can see harvester must make DC 16 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute. Plant Nightmare: Implants recurring nightmare in sleeping creature's mind, causing exhaustion until removed by greater restoration or similar magic (1/day).

monsters.name: Astral Kraken
monsters.damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.description: Astral krakens are legendary entities that rule vast regions of the Astral Plane like cosmic gods. These immense cephalopods have mastered the manipulation of thought and reality itself. Their very presence warps the astral medium, creating pocket dimensions and temporal anomalies.
monsters.traits: Legendary Resistance (3/Day): If fails saving throw, can choose to succeed instead. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Astral Dominion: Controls astral currents in 1-mile radius, can alter travel times and destinations. Reality Anchor: Immune to effects that would banish, teleport, or plane shift it against its will.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes three tentacle attacks and one bite, or uses Psychic Storm and makes two tentacle attacks. Tentacle: +17 to hit, reach 30 ft., 3d6+10 bludgeoning plus target is grappled (escape DC 25) and restrained. Kraken has 10 tentacles, each can grapple one target. Bite: +17 to hit, reach 5 ft., 3d8+10 piercing. If target is Large or smaller creature grappled by kraken, target must make DC 25 Dexterity save or be swallowed. Psychic Storm: 120-foot radius, all creatures make DC 19 Intelligence save or take 6d6 psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. Fling: Throws grappled creature up to 120 feet, dealing 3d6 bludgeoning damage. Legendary Actions (3): Tentacle attack, move without provoking opportunity attacks, or Psychic Pulse (costs 2 actions, 60-foot radius, DC 19 Wisdom save or 2d8 psychic damage).

monsters.name: Cave Beetle
monsters.description: Cave beetles are large, armored insects that scuttle through underground passages feeding on fungi and organic debris. Their hard carapaces reflect sound, helping them navigate in complete darkness. These creatures are generally harmless but can swarm when their territory is disturbed.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Echolocation: Can navigate and locate objects through sound reflection, unaffected by lack of light.
monsters.actions: Bite: +3 to hit, 1d4+1 piercing. Defensive Ball: Can curl into armored ball as reaction, AC becomes 16 but speed becomes 0 until uncurled. Pheromone Trail: Leaves scent trail that other cave beetles can follow for up to 24 hours. Debris Shower: When climbing on ceiling, can drop rocks and debris on creatures below in 5-foot radius, DC 11 Dexterity save or 1d4 bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Glowing Mushroom
monsters.description: Glowing mushrooms are bioluminescent fungi that provide eerie illumination in cave systems. While they appear harmless, these organisms release toxic spores when disturbed. Their soft light attracts both prey and predators, creating complex underground ecosystems.
monsters.traits: Bioluminescence: Sheds bright light in 10-foot radius and dim light for additional 10 feet. False Appearance: While motionless, indistinguishable from ordinary mushroom. Spore Network: Can communicate with other fungi within 120 feet through chemical signals.
monsters.actions: Toxic Spores: When damaged, releases spores in 10-foot radius. Each creature in area must make DC 11 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 minute and suffer hallucinations (disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks). Light Burst: Can brighten to shed bright light in 30-foot radius for 1 minute, potentially blinding creatures accustomed to darkness (DC 10 Constitution save or blinded for 1 round). Spore Message: Can send chemical signals to other fungi, potentially alerting them to danger or prey.

monsters.name: Cave Fisher
monsters.description: Cave fishers are large, lobster-like predators that lurk on cave ceilings and rocky ledges. They use extendable filaments to snare prey from great distances, then reel them in for consumption. Their chitinous shells blend perfectly with cave stone, making them nearly invisible until they strike.
monsters.traits: Adhesive Filament: Can shoot sticky filament up to 60 feet. Hit creature is grappled (escape DC 15). Filament can be severed (AC 15, 5 HP) or retracted as bonus action. Spider Climb: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without ability checks. Cave Camouflage: Has advantage on Stealth checks while motionless against stone surfaces.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two claw attacks. Claw: +7 to hit, 2d6+5 slashing. Filament: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., target grappled and pulled up to 60 feet toward fisher. Reel In: Pulls grappled creature up to 30 feet closer and makes claw attack with advantage. Ceiling Drop: If positioned above target, can drop down and make claw attack with advantage, potentially knocking target prone (DC 15 Dexterity save).

monsters.name: Piercer
monsters.senses: Blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 8
monsters.description: Piercers are cone-shaped predators that cling to cave ceilings disguised as stalactites. These patient hunters wait for prey to pass beneath before dropping down with devastating force. Their rocky exterior makes them nearly impossible to detect until it's too late.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, indistinguishable from normal stalactite. Spider Climb: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without ability checks.
monsters.actions: Drop: Makes attack against creature directly below by dropping. +3 to hit, 3d6 piercing damage. If attack hits by 4 or more, target is knocked prone. After dropping, piercer loses climb speed until it can reattach to ceiling. Reattach: Can slowly climb back to ceiling position over course of 10 minutes. Patient Ambush: Can remain motionless for days waiting for prey, requiring no food or water during this time.

monsters.name: Blind Cave Bear
monsters.description: Blind cave bears are massive ursines that have adapted to life in complete darkness over countless generations. Their eyes have atrophied completely, but their other senses have become supernaturally acute. These powerful predators navigate by scent and sound, making them formidable hunters in their domain.
monsters.traits: Keen Hearing and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell. Blind Fighting: Darkness and invisibility don't hinder combat abilities. Hibernation: Can enter deep sleep for months, requiring no food and being difficult to wake (DC 20 to rouse).
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claw. Bite: +7 to hit, 1d8+5 piercing. Claw: +7 to hit, 2d6+5 slashing. Deafening Roar: Each creature within 30 feet must make DC 13 Constitution save or be deafened for 1 minute and frightened until end of next turn (recharge 5-6). Scent Tracking: Can track creatures by smell for up to 24 hours, even through running water.

monsters.name: Crystal Crawler
monsters.condition_immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
monsters.description: Crystal crawlers are artificial creatures formed from enchanted cave crystals and gemstones. These multi-legged constructs skitter through mineral-rich caverns, their bodies refracting light in dazzling patterns. They were originally created to mine precious stones but some have gained independence.
monsters.traits: Crystal Body: When takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet must make DC 12 Dexterity save or take 1d4 piercing damage from crystal shards. Light Refraction: In bright light, attacks against crawler have disadvantage.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two claw attacks. Claw: +4 to hit, 1d6+2 slashing plus 1d4 piercing. Prismatic Flash: Creates bright light in 15-foot cone. Each creature in area must make DC 12 Constitution save or be blinded for 1 round (recharge 5-6). Gem Detection: Can sense precious stones and metals within 60 feet, even through solid rock.

monsters.name: Roper
monsters.description: Ropers are massive cone-shaped predators that resemble stalagmites until they reveal their true nature. These ancient creatures use multiple tentacles to drag prey into their crushing maws. Their rocky exterior and patient hunting style make them apex ambush predators in cave systems.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, indistinguishable from normal stalagmite. Grasping Tendrils: Has six tendrils, each can grapple one Medium or smaller creature. Spider Climb: Can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without ability checks.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes four attacks with tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one bite attack. Bite: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., 4d8+4 piercing. Tendril: +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until grapple ends, target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and saves. Reel: Pulls each grappled creature up to 25 feet straight toward it. Weakening Grasp: Grappled creatures take 1d6 necrotic damage at start of each turn and have maximum hit points reduced by damage taken.

monsters.name: Darkmantle
monsters.description: Darkmantles are predatory creatures that resemble flying manta rays with the ability to create zones of magical darkness. These cave dwellers drop from ceilings onto unsuspecting prey, enveloping them in suffocating darkness while crushing them with powerful tentacles.
monsters.traits: Echolocation: Can't use blindsight while deafened. False Appearance: While motionless on ceiling, indistinguishable from cave formation.
monsters.actions: Crush: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d6+3 bludgeoning. If target is Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on DC 13 Dexterity save or be grappled and creature is blinded until grapple ends. Darkness Aura: Creates sphere of magical darkness in 15-foot radius that moves with darkmantle. Area is heavily obscured and magical light of 2nd level or lower is suppressed. Suffocate: Grappled creature cannot breathe and takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage at start of each turn.

monsters.name: Bulezau Miner
monsters.description: Bulezau miners are specialized demons that excavate infernal tunnels and mine soul gems from cave walls. These rotting, minotaur-like fiends leave trails of pestilence wherever they dig. Their presence corrupts cave systems, turning them into hellish labyrinths filled with toxic gases and unstable passages.
monsters.traits: Rotting Presence: Each creature starting turn within 5 feet must make DC 14 Constitution save or be poisoned until start of next turn. Standing Leap: Can long jump up to 20 feet and high jump up to 10 feet without running start. Tunneling: Can burrow through solid rock at 5 feet per hour, leaving 5-foot diameter tunnel.
monsters.actions: Barbed Tail: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1d6+2 piercing plus 1d6 poison damage. Fists: +4 to hit, 2d4+2 bludgeoning. If both hit same target, target must make DC 14 Constitution save or be stunned until end of next turn. Mining Pick: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 piercing. Can damage stone and metal structures. Toxic Excavation: Creates 10-foot radius cloud of poisonous gas that lasts 1 minute. Creatures starting turn in area take 1d4 poison damage (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Purple Worm
monsters.senses: Blindsight 30 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 14
monsters.description: Purple worms are colossal tunneling creatures that can grow to over 80 feet in length. These massive predators create extensive cave networks as they burrow through solid rock in search of prey. Their acidic digestive systems can dissolve almost any organic material, and their poisonous stingers can fell giants.
monsters.traits: Tunneler: Can burrow through solid rock at half speed and leaves 10-foot diameter tunnel. Tremorsense: Can detect and pinpoint origin of vibrations within 60 feet.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one tail stinger. Bite: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., 3d8+9 piercing. If target is Large or smaller creature, must make DC 19 Dexterity save or be swallowed. Swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover, and takes 3d6 acid damage at start of each worm's turn. Tail Stinger: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., 3d6+9 piercing plus 6d6 poison damage. Target must make DC 19 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 hour. While poisoned, target's hit point maximum is reduced by poison damage taken. Burrow Attack: Emerges from underground within 10 feet of target and makes bite attack with advantage. Ground Shake: Strikes ground, creating tremor in 30-foot radius. All creatures in area must make DC 19 Dexterity save or be knocked prone and take 2d6 bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Forest Sprite
monsters.description: Forest sprites are tiny fey creatures with gossamer wings and a deep connection to woodland magic. They appear as miniature humanoids with bark-like skin and hair that changes color with the seasons. These mischievous guardians protect sacred groves and play pranks on those who disrespect nature.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Forest Camouflage: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in forest terrain. Plant Speech: Can communicate with plants as if they shared a language.
monsters.actions: Thorn Dart: +6 to hit, range 20/60 ft., 1 piercing plus target must make DC 10 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 minute. Invisibility: Magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell. Nature's Blessing: Touches a plant to accelerate its growth or restore it to health. Fairy Ring: Creates circle of mushrooms that provides sanctuary for Small or smaller creatures (1/day).

monsters.name: Badger
monsters.description: Badgers are small but fierce burrowing mammals with powerful claws and a tenacious attitude. Despite their size, these creatures are fearless defenders of their territory and young. Their keen sense of smell and digging ability make them excellent foragers and formidable opponents when cornered.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Brave: Has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
monsters.actions: Bite: +2 to hit, 1d4-1 piercing. Claw: +2 to hit, 1d4-1 slashing. Defensive Stance: Grants itself +2 AC until start of next turn but cannot move (can use as bonus action). Fierce Protector: When defending young or territory, gains advantage on attack rolls and deals +1 damage.

monsters.name: Elk
monsters.description: Elk are majestic cervids with impressive antlers that roam through forests and meadows in herds. These graceful herbivores are generally peaceful but become aggressive during mating season or when protecting their young. Their speed and antlers make them dangerous when threatened.
monsters.traits: Keen Hearing and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell. Charge: If moves at least 20 feet toward target and hits with ram, target takes extra 1d6 damage.
monsters.actions: Ram: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 bludgeoning. Hooves: +5 to hit, 2d4+3 bludgeoning (only against prone targets). Alert Call: Makes loud call that can be heard up to 1 mile away, potentially alerting other elk or forest creatures. Antler Lock: If two male elk fight, they may become locked together (both restrained until DC 15 Strength check to break free).

monsters.name: Wood Elf Scout
monsters.description: Wood elf scouts are graceful forest dwellers who serve as guardians and pathfinders for their communities. They wear earth-toned clothing that helps them blend with woodland surroundings and carry finely crafted bows. These skilled rangers can move through forests without leaving a trace.
monsters.traits: Fey Ancestry: Advantage on saves against being charmed, magic can't put the elf to sleep. Forest Camouflage: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in forest terrain. Keen Senses: Proficiency bonus doubled for Wisdom (Perception) checks.
monsters.actions: Shortsword: +5 to hit, 1d6+3 piercing. Longbow: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., 1d8+3 piercing. Hidden Step: Can take Hide action as bonus action. Forest Knowledge: Can track creatures through forest terrain and identify plants, animals, and natural hazards. Elven Accuracy: When has advantage on attack roll using Dexterity, can reroll one of the dice once.

monsters.name: Owlbear
monsters.description: Owlbears are ferocious predators that combine the worst aspects of owls and bears. These massive creatures nest in forest caves and hollow trees, emerging to hunt with devastating efficiency. Their keen senses and powerful limbs make them apex predators in woodland environments.
monsters.traits: Keen Sight and Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one beak and one claw. Beak: +7 to hit, 1d10+5 piercing. Claw: +7 to hit, 2d8+5 slashing. Pounce: If moves at least 20 feet toward target and hits with claw, target must make DC 15 Strength save or be knocked prone. If target is prone, owlbear can make one beak attack as bonus action. Territorial Roar: Each creature within 30 feet must make DC 13 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute (recharge 5-6).

monsters.name: Dryad
monsters.description: Dryads are beautiful tree spirits bound to specific oak trees in ancient forests. They appear as graceful humanoid women with bark-like skin and hair resembling leaves. These benevolent fey are fierce protectors of their woodland homes and can call upon nature's power to defend themselves.
monsters.traits: Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Speak with Beasts and Plants: Can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language. Tree Stride: Once per turn, can use 10 feet of movement to step into living tree within reach and emerge from second tree within 60 feet.
monsters.actions: Club: +2 to hit, 1d4 bludgeoning. Fey Charm: Target humanoid within 30 feet must make DC 14 Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 day. While charmed, target idolizes dryad and tries to help her. Barkskin: AC becomes 16 for 1 hour (1/day). Entangle: Grasping weeds and vines sprout in 20-foot square within 60 feet, DC 14 Strength save or restrained for 1 minute (1/day).

monsters.name: Brown Bear
monsters.description: Brown bears are powerful omnivores that rule forest territories through size and strength. These massive creatures can weigh over 800 pounds and stand 9 feet tall on their hind legs. While generally avoiding humans, they become extremely dangerous when protecting cubs or food sources.
monsters.traits: Keen Smell: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one bite and one claw. Bite: +5 to hit, 1d8+4 piercing. Claw: +5 to hit, 2d6+4 slashing. Standing Threat: Rears up on hind legs to appear larger, forcing creatures within 30 feet to make DC 13 Wisdom save or be frightened until end of next turn. Maul: If both claw attacks hit same target, target is grappled (escape DC 15) and takes 1d8+4 bludgeoning damage at start of each turn.

monsters.name: Treant Sapling
monsters.description: Treant saplings are young tree shepherds who have not yet reached their massive adult size. Standing about 8 feet tall, they appear as humanoid trees with kind but stern expressions. These wise guardians protect sacred groves and guide lost travelers to safety.
monsters.traits: False Appearance: While motionless, indistinguishable from normal tree. Speak with Plants: Can communicate with plants as if they shared a language. Forest Network: Can sense disturbances in forest within 1 mile through root and fungal networks.
monsters.actions: Slam: +4 to hit, 1d8+2 bludgeoning. Rock: +4 to hit, range 60/180 ft., 1d10+2 bludgeoning. Animate Trees: Causes 1d2 trees within 60 feet to become animated for 1 day (1/day). They have awakened tree statistics but only 30 hit points. Root Entangle: Roots erupt in 20-foot radius, DC 12 Strength save or restrained for 1 minute. Nature's Guidance: Provides directions and safe passage through forest terrain.

monsters.name: Unicorn
monsters.description: Unicorns are legendary celestial beings that appear as magnificent white horses with spiraling horns. These pure creatures are symbols of grace and nobility, dwelling in the most sacred parts of ancient forests. Only the pure of heart can approach them, and their presence purifies the land around them.
monsters.traits: Charge: If moves at least 20 feet toward target and hits with horn, deals extra 2d8 piercing damage. Magic Resistance: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Magic Weapons: Weapon attacks are magical. Innate Spellcasting: Can cast detect evil and good, druidcraft, and pass without trace at will. 1/day each: calm emotions, dispel evil and good, entangle.
monsters.actions: Multiattack: Makes two attacks: one horn and one hooves. Horn: +7 to hit, 1d8+4 piercing plus 2d8 radiant damage. Hooves: +7 to hit, 2d6+4 bludgeoning. Healing Touch: Touches creature with horn to heal 2d8+2 hit points and remove any disease or poison (3/day). Teleport: Magically teleports up to 1 mile to location it can visualize (1/day). Purifying Presence: All water within 30 feet is purified and evil creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls.

monsters.name: Green Dragon Wyrmling
monsters.senses: Blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12
monsters.description: Green dragon wyrmlings are the youngest of the chromatic dragons, already displaying the cunning and cruelty that will define them as adults. They inhabit deep forests where they can ambush prey from among the trees. Even as juveniles, they possess deadly poison breath and manipulative intelligence.
monsters.traits: Amphibious: Can breathe air and water. Forest Camouflage: Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in forest terrain.
monsters.actions: Bite: +4 to hit, 1d10+2 piercing plus 1d4 poison damage. Poison Breath (Recharge 5-6): Exhales poisonous gas in 15-foot cone. Each creature in area must make DC 11 Constitution save, taking 5d6 poison damage on failed save or half on success. Manipulate: Uses honeyed words to try to convince target to do something beneficial to dragon, DC 11 Wisdom save or charmed for 1 hour. Arboreal Ambush: When hiding in trees, gains advantage on first attack against surprised creatures.
